location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I'm so disgusted by these people!! Don't come here!!! If I could rate it -5,000 stars, I would. Everything—absolutely everything—about this so-called turtle conservation park is designed solely to make money. There's no evidence that the animals here will ever be released back into the wild. Snakes with their mouths taped shut, birds chained, and turtles kept in too-small pools solely for tourist entertainment. The animals are here purely for profit and are kept in appalling conditions.

The entire concept of this place is to take money from tourists in every way; they're constantly trying to sell you everything. You're asked to pay to feed the animals, forced to buy cheap fake souvenirs, sell photos, and even have to pay to use the restroom. We paid an exorbitant 76 Euros for two people for a 10-minute boat trip on a "glass boat" supposedly to "see turtles" (which turned out not to exist) just to arrive at this place. It's not an island, but rather a mainland. It's a complete scam to trick "dumb" tourists. Again, don't fall for it!!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Actually dunno how to feel about this. Our guide was so nice told about that is non govr. organisation. We adopt turtle for two of us was it 700 000 rp all together we felt great after visiting organization seems really improved after I saw reviews. But still have weird felling when I saw snakes in taped heads.When we visited water was clean, they seems really curious w turtles,we got answers on all our questions. On our visit was no snakes.We didn't feel there is any currently on animal people there seems to be so good and they love animals. Maybe they just good liars :D hard no say really. If is it how they said I realy recommend to visit. Other aminals like iguanas,monkey,olw been in cages they told us bc of actually rainy season here. They mentioned they are free to room around during the day, but closed at night, when it rains.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Kondisi Hidup Penyu Sangat Mengkhawatirkan: Mereka Dikurung Dalam Kolam-Kolam Kecil Dan Dangkal, Tanpa Memperhatikan Kebutuhan Alami Mereka. Ini Jauh Dari Sebuah Pusat Konservasi Yang Sesungguhnya: Tempat Ini Lebih Seperti Atraksi Wisata Yang Menyamar, Tanpa Tujuan Edukasi Maupun Ekologis. Penyu-Penyu Terus-Menerus Dipegang Untuk Berfoto Sepanjang Hari, Yang Jelas Menyebabkan Stres Pada Hewan Liar Ini.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I strongly do not recommend this visit.

The turtles' living conditions are appalling: they are confined in small, shallow pools, with no regard for their natural needs. This is far from a true conservation center: it's more like a disguised tourist attraction, with no educational or ecological purpose. The turtles are constantly held for photos throughout the day, which is clearly stressful for these wild animals.

The staff were also very pushy throughout the visit, pushing visitors to purchase additional options and even asking for tips at the end of the tour, making the experience even more unpleasant. We truly felt trapped in a purely commercial scheme.

I regret coming here. If you care even the slightest about animal welfare, skip this place and seek out a real conservation center like Serangan, which takes its work seriously and responsibly.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
A Mixed Visit… The Turtle Farm does indeed feature a wide variety of animals, but it quickly becomes apparent that everything is designed for mass tourism. Every enclosure and pool seems to exist solely so visitors can take ‘exotic’ photos, often at the expense of the animals’ welfare.

The place clearly lacks authenticity and lacks educational value: Visitors leave with more selfies than knowledge about turtles or their conservation efforts. The approach is, unfortunately, very superficial.

The only truly touching and meaningful moment is the release of baby turtles into the sea. This symbolic act, while brief, brings back the essentials and lends some meaning to the rest of the visit, which is highly commercial.

In conclusion: A very touristy attraction, even too touristy, with a good initial idea that has somewhat lost its focus on profit.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
It's a horrible place with all the animals in a terrible state. I was told the animals were all rescued and they are released once they have recovered. Frankly, this is a total lie. Do not go there, the place need to be shut down.
 I was so angry and upset when I got there! Shame on them!

review_text: ANIMAL ABUSE !!!! THIS PLACE NEEDS TO BE SHUT DOWN IMMEDIATELY!!!! Most of the "good" reviews are from bots or people who must be blind to animal torture!!!! Dead baby turtles floating in the tanks, the big turtles are overcrowded and underfed !!! The other animals are in horrendous condition. They don't set these animals free, you can literally tell by all the pictures being taken over the years that the same turtles are still being kept there with no intentions of being freed back into the ocean !!! The workers or "volunteers" Hassel you for money which is obviously the money is NOT being used to better these animals conditions. This place is pathetic. Something needs to be done to help these poor animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Mixed feelings about our visit here. We came mainly because the kids were excited to see turtles up close — and they absolutely loved the experience. From their perspective, it was magical, and they were completely oblivious to the bigger picture.
 
 But as a parent and someone who cares about animal welfare, I couldn’t ignore the concerning conditions the turtles and other wildlife were kept in. The enclosures felt small and poorly maintained, and the presence of other animals like birds and reptiles didn’t seem aligned with a true conservation effort.
 
 Sadly, while the experience was memorable for the kids, it will be our first and last visit to this place. I’ll definitely be looking for alternative sanctuaries or centers that prioritize the health and dignity of the wildlife in their care. I truly hope to see more transparency and better conditions here in the future.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
“Saya Harus Mengatakan Bahwa Saya Tidak Akan Datang Ke Sini Lagi! Di Tempat Ini Ada Hewan-Hewan Yang Jelas Bukan Hasil Penyelamatan, Melainkan Hanya Untuk Dipamerkan Dan Ditahan Dengan Rantai. Sejak Awal, Pemandu Menjelaskan Dari Mana Ia Dibayar Dan Dari Uang Apa Hewan-Hewan Diberi Makan. Ia Cukup Menekan Kami, Meskipun Berkali-Kali Mengatakan Bahwa Ia Tidak Menekan.

Menurut Saya, Seluruh Konsep Tempat Ini Sangat Buruk. Ini Lebih Seperti Permainan Emosi Dengan Ajakan ‘Adopsi Penyu’. Anda Membayar 400 Ribu Untuk Adopsi Penyu Dan Pelepasannya Ke Laut, Lalu 100 Ribu Sebagai Tip Untuk Pemandu. Sebelum Tur, Tentu Saja Ada Biaya Perahu Dan Tiket Masuk Ke ‘Cagar’ Di Pulau.

Saya Berharap Setidaknya Kami Telah Membantu Penyu-Penyu Yang Dilepaskan Agar Tidak Terjebak Di Tempat Ini.

review_text: Di sini kita bisa melihat penyu langka di lindungi, di pelihara sebelum kembali di lepas liarkan. Selain melihat penyu pengunjung jg bisa berfoto dg ular, burung hantu dan burung engang. Sedikit info di sini untuk bayar foto sedikit lebih mahal anggap saja untuk menyumbang kawasan konservasi ini.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Deluang Sari Turtle Conservation Center: Tempat Menumbuhkan Harapan Bagi Lautan

Saat menginjakkan kaki di Deluang Sari Turtle Conservation Center, Anda akan merasakan suasana yang tenang, di mana upaya-upaya sunyi dilakukan siang dan malam untuk menumbuhkan harapan bagi masa depan penyu laut yang langka. Tidak ramai dan hiruk-pikuk seperti destinasi wisata lainnya, pusat ini menghadirkan gambaran yang jujur dan mendalam tentang tantangan dalam upaya konservasi.

Menyaksikan tukik-tukik kecil yang baru menetas serta penyu dewasa yang dirawat dengan penuh perhatian, Anda akan tersentuh oleh keajaiban alam dan semakin menyadari tanggung jawab manusia dalam melindunginya. Kolam penetasan yang bersih, informasi edukatif yang mudah dipahami, serta antusiasme para staf menyampaikan pesan kuat tentang pentingnya konservasi penyu laut.

Deluang Sari bukan hanya tempat perlindungan, tetapi juga menjadi jembatan antara manusia dan alam. Pengunjung memiliki kesempatan untuk mempelajari siklus hidup dan perilaku penyu laut, berbagai ancaman yang mereka hadapi, serta tindakan nyata yang dapat dilakukan setiap orang untuk berkontribusi. Saat meninggalkan pusat ini, akan tertinggal rasa penghargaan yang mendalam terhadap lautan dan makhluk luar biasa yang hidup di dalamnya, disertai keyakinan akan arti penting dari upaya-upaya konservasi ini. Tempat ini benar-benar merupakan destinasi edukatif yang menggugah emosi.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This place doesn't exist. As we were travelling there, we were accosted by a lady at a different turtle farm, claiming to be the same place. (Take note "farm" not conservation centre or sanctuary). Keep in mind they will all claim to be the place that you actually want to go to.
 
 We walked away to where it was located on the map and saw some pitiful sights of animals kept in unsuitable conditions through back alley fences along the way there.
 
 When we got there, it wasn't even there. It's just a big bike shed. And we were once again greeted by a lady from a different farm, claiming to be this business.
 
 Just be wary of these turtle businesses around this area. Very shady.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Where do I being. Firstly, this place is not worth the price. We took a glass boat that only had a small portion of it as glass to feed fish and that was not exciting in the least. We were told we had to pay for the boat to get to turtle island which doesn't make sense since we can't walk there.
 
 Secondly, Its not an island of turtles as I previously thought since it's called "turtle island"... but when we arrived, it was a few tanks with turtles and and a small pond with alot of turtles ( i don't know how they all manage to fit in this habitat).
 
 The other animals were a snake, an owl, a toucan, a bat and some iguanas. Their enclosures look terrible and unkept. What was unsettling was seeing how tight the snakes mouth was taped. I hate seeing animals kept in environments like this (chained, and in old, small cages).
 
 We were told that the people that work here are volunteers but as soon as we arrived all we could hear was talk about "donations."
 
 This place is not worth any price and the animals should be in better facilities. Nothing about this place impressed me.
 
 We didn't want to go here in the first place but the lady was persistent and got upset that we wanted to leave. Eventually someone else came and dropped the price to half which should have raised my suspicion immediately.

review_text: This place is an absolute hole. DO NOT GO! We were told it was a sanctuary and paid a small fortune (almost AUD200!!!) For the glass bottom boat tour where were promised a variety of fish and reefs but only got a few mins of fish feeding and then zooming through. This hole was so distressing as we have actively avoided exploitative animal attractions and i feel so silly and wish I'd read the reviews first instead of being pressured in. The turtles were sad but nothing could have prepared me for the birds chained up in dirty cages. Awful place. And then to top it off the staff are so pushy for tips. Please do not visit!

review_text: Het is mooi dat ze jaarlijks duizenden schildpadden in de natuur vrijlaten die anders nooit geboren zouden zijn. Dat draagt zeker bij aan het behoud van de soort. Voor €20 kun je zelf een schildpad adopteren en vrijlaten, maar in werkelijkheid zitten deze baby’s gewoon in een waterbak te wachten tot ze verkocht worden. Het voelt meer als een commerciële attractie dan een echt natuurbeschermingsproject. Daarom geef ik twee sterren.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not recommend. We were under the impression that this was a “conservation” or a “sanctuary” for turtles. They said the turtles were there in the hospital for rehabilitation from being in the ocean with plastic and predators, however one of the areas they were keeping the turtles was full of rubbish. The other turtles were swimming in dirty shallow water in a very small and crowded tank. They then showed us other animals- cockatoos, owls, toucans, snakes, bats, turkeys and iguanas. This made us very sad. The owl was chained up and was trying to fly away at one stage, the snakes had their mouths taped shut, one of the toucans looked so miserable and frightened (I’m not even sure why they have these animals in a “turtle hospital”). They were very persistent and wanted us to all get photos with the animals, when told no they kept egging us on. They then wanted us to purchase photos that they took of us with the turtle statue, they took us to a shop with random stuff to buy, we also noticed a sign in the toilet saying 2000 rp!! Why are they charging us to use the toilet?!! The lady showing us around also mentioned a few times that she was just a volunteer and she only gets paid off of tips, insinuating she wanted us to give her money. Do not waste your time here! I wish I had read the reviews on this place before coming and I hope this enough to deter people from spending their money on going.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sangat Mengerikan!
Jauhilah Tempat Ini. Saya Tidak Mengerti Penilaian Bintang Lima Yang Ada. Siapa Pun Yang Pergi Dari Tempat Ini Dengan Perasaan Baik, Tidak Memiliki Hati Untuk Hewan. Telur Penyu Diambil Dari Habitat Alaminya Lalu Dipaksakan Untuk ‘Dijual’ Kepada Wisatawan. Pengunjung Ditekan Untuk Mengadopsi Penyu, Bukan Untuk Membantu Penyu Dengan Uangnya, Melainkan Agar Petugas Dibayar. Eksploitasi Hewan Seperti Ini Sangat Jarang Terlihat.

Penyu-Penyu Dewasa Sengaja Tidak Diberi Makan Agar Mereka Mendekati Wisatawan Demi Mendapatkan Makanan. Mereka Hidup Bertumpuk Di Dalam Kubangan Air Kotor. Saat Ditanya Mengapa Penyu-Penyu Dewasa Ada Di Sini, Jawabannya Adalah ‘Untuk Turis’.

Sayangnya, Penyu Bukan Satu-Satunya Hewan Yang Menderita Di Tempat Ini. Burung, Burung Hantu, Dan Kelelawar Dirantai Di Batang Besi Dan Tidak Bisa Bergerak Bebas. Ular-Ular Direkatkan Mulutnya Dengan Selotip Agar Bisa Difoto. Lalu Terlihat Wisatawan Yang Tidak Peduli Dengan Senang Hati Mengambil Foto Dan Video, Sambil Menganggap Ini Sebagai Proyek ‘Penyelamatan’ Yang Hebat. Di Sini Muncul Pertanyaan, Apakah Sebagian Orang Telah Kehilangan Rasa Kemanusiaannya.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This is a terrible place. They say they are a conservation for turtles and they release them after a certain age. They had 4 areas with turtles. The babies, young, middle age, and old. The oldest turtle there is 20 years old. I asked why that turtles wasn’t released yet and the answer I got was “he isn’t old enough yet.” The other turtles were 4 years and 10 years old. The lady said they kept those for breeding. The babies she said they release once matured. I asked an age of released and her response was “well you can adopt one and we will release it.” Then she said we could feed them so our group fed every ounce of food they gave us and the poor turtles were stepping on each other to get to food. Then, I turned the corner only to find other animals. Amongst these animals were birds that’s were chained and a snake that had his mouth taped. I couldn’t even ask questions, I got so mad I walked away as she was talking to me.
 
 The only positive thing about this place is that they use a filter system so when it’s high tide the turtles get actual ocean water into their tanks. But then again the ocean was so full of trash I truly do not know if it is a positive thing or not.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Animals are in deplorable conditions. Tiny turtles in like a 20 gallon tank and big turtles in shallow pools, one on top of the other. Birds are chained up and snake has tape around it's mouth to keep it from biting. Please do not support.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: All these places are absolute tourist traps. Avoid them.

review_text:
AVOID, AVOID, AVOID...
 
 Very dirty, animals kept in very, very poor standards. But the worst thing is the constant (and I mean from start to finish) badgering to spend money. I DO NOT recommend at all.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I wish I’d read the reviews of this place before going. I thought it was a turtle sanctuary / conservation based. The conditions made me cry and still hours later I feel so conflicted that I went here with my family. This place is unethical, animals are not treated well and the place is so run down. I wanted to leave and was probably naive to the spiel initially that more money was needed to improve conditions. Birds in small cages, snake’s mouth taped over, turtles in dirty water. My heart breaks for what is an animal jail.
 
 The Boat ride over on a glass bottom boat where the glass was so dirty you couldn’t see anything.
 
 Expensive scam that is basically torturing animals. Do not go.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Turtle Island is a must visit. You will see 100 years old turtles and other creatures.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Kami Berdua Membayar 90 Euro Per Orang Untuk Sebuah Tur Yang Katanya Termasuk Satu Jam Snorkeling Dan Kunjungan Ke Pulau Penyu. Sayangnya, Pengalaman Ini Sangat Mengecewakan.

1. Kondisi Hewan: Penyu-Penyu Dikurung Dalam Kolam Berisi Air Kotor Penuh Kotoran. Sangat Menyedihkan Untuk Dilihat.
2. Perlakuan Buruk Terhadap Hewan: Seekor Monyet Diikat Dengan Rantai Besi, Dan Kami Melihat Seekor Ular Serta Dua Burung Pelikan Yang Tampak Seperti Dibius. Ini Sama Sekali Tidak Dapat Diterima.
3. Tidak Sebanding Dengan Harga: Aktivitas Snorkeling Juga Sama Mengecewakannya, Dan Secara Keseluruhan Pengalaman Ini Sama Sekali Tidak Sepadan Dengan Harga 90 Euro Per Orang. Anda Membayar Mahal Untuk Kegiatan Yang Tidak Menarik Sama Sekali.**

Kesimpulannya, Saya Sangat Tidak Merekomendasikan Tur Ini. Kami Hanya Kehilangan Waktu Dan Uang, Sambil Menyaksikan Perlakuan Buruk Terhadap Hewan.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Staf kurang informatif.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place was more of a concentration camp for animals than a conservation place , exploiting animals for profit is their modus operandi, they put sticky tape on the snakes mouths which is great for the timid tourists handling them , but rather distressing for the snake , the chains around the legs of the exotic parrots was a nice touch, also the filthy pond which had baby turtles both living and dead ones floating aimlessly was another brilliant attraction, if you enjoy watching animal cruelty you need to visit this place

review_text: Dit was echt een aanfluiting....wat een vervelende mensen werken hier, opdringerig , ze beginnen heel aardig maar daarna zijn ze alleen maar uit op je geld, donaties zogezegd..De beesten waren hier voor hun herstel, leven in gevangenschap, maar de toeristen mochten wel continu met ze op de foto, lijkt me niet goed voor deze beesten, we hadden bij het hele gebeuren daar zo onze twijfels en waren snel weer vertrokken.Bootreisje erheen was wel leuk.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Itu tempat nya turis trap. di web harga nya Rp. 10.000 tapi pas datang digetok Rp100.000. untuk survey juga mereka tidak memperbolehkan, dan penangkaran sekitar nya pun sama digetok harga yang mahal Rp.100.000. Mereka mau menurunkan RP50.000 tapi itu juga masih sangat mahal untuk sekedar melihat penyu, mereka mempermainkan harga!
 
 It's a tourist trap. On the website the price is $ 0,66 but when you arrive they charge you $6,60. They also don't allow you to do a survey, and the surrounding breeding grounds also charge a high price of $6,60. They want to lower it to $3,30 but that's still very expensive just to see the turtles, they're playing with the price!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The children are thoroughly enjoying their time here.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Avoid at all costs. It deserves -5 stars as a minimum.
 There is no animal welfare whatsoever. God knows how many fully grown adult turtles are living in a muddy puddle.
 This place is designed to separate you from your money in as many ways as possible.
 Don’t be fooled into a boat trip to “the island” from the Bintamg water sports centre.
 It’s actually on the same peninsula and can be reached by car. We couldn’t get out of there fast enough.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is not a conservation place. This is purely abusing animals for profit. Turtles swimming in very shallow water, dirty, and with their own filth. Guests picking them up like some damn cat. Snakes have their mouth shut by the tape. And the government is not even doing anything about its animal welfare. This place is just wrong on so many levels!!! Shame on you!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Tahukah kamu, 1 diantara 8 tempat penangkara penyu di Indonesia ternyata ada di Bali. Iya, namanya Deluang Sari. Tempat penangkaran penyu ini sudah tidak asing lagi bagi para wisatawan yang sudah pernah menikmati liburan di Bali terutama yang sering singgah dan main watersport Tanjung Benoa.
 
 Deluang Sari adalah sebuah delta kecil di kawasan Tanjung Benoa Bali yang oleh penduduk setempat dipergunakan untuk tempat penangkaran penyu. Terletak sekitar 13 Km dari Bandara Ngurah Rai, butuh sekitar 15 menit perjalanan menuju Pulau Penyu Bali dengan menggunakan glass bottom boat. Di sekitar lokasi ini merupakan kawasan hutan bakau (mangrove) yang dilindungi negara. Laut yang berpantai pasir putih, dengan gelombangnya yang tenang, terletak menghadap dengan pusat rekreasi laut Pelabuhan Benoa. Karena memiliki sistem ekologi yang utuh, pantainya yang bersih, hutan bakaunya yang subur, maka tempat ini telah dikembangkan untuk penangkaran Penyu laut. Selain itu ada juga rumah makan, toko cindera mata dan tempat atraksi pertunjukan satwa lainnya.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Suasana membuat pengunjung tidak betah.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not go here. Such an awful experience. They seem all nice to talk to you but the welfare of the animals is not cared for. They are pushy for releasing a baby turtle and tip. This was definitely not what we were expecting. Not sure how this is conservation. Would not recommend if you like animals by the slightest unless you want to go to release a baby turtle so it no longer has to live in horror there.

review_text: Kami tiba sore, jadi sudah sepi dan kondisi pantai sudah surut. Jadi tantangan untuk jalan kaki dilaut.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: “PALSU! Tempat Ini Tidak Bisa Direkomendasikan. Ini Adalah Perangkap Turis! Hewan-Hewan Dipelihara Dalam Kondisi Yang Sangat Memprihatinkan. Apa Hubungannya Iguana Dari Meksiko Berada Di Dalam Kandang Di Bali Di Sebuah Tempat Penampungan? Saya Tidak Melihat Satu Pun Hewan Yang Benar-Benar Membutuhkan Perawatan. Bayi Penyu Hanya Disalahgunakan Untuk Mengambil Uang. Penyu Dengan Bekas Gigitan Hiu Yang Sudah Lama Sembuh Atau Dengan Kaki Yang Pernah Dimakan Tetapi Sudah Sembuh, Disalahgunakan Sebagai ‘Hewan Perawatan’. Hewan Lain Ditahan Di Dalam Kandang Tanpa Alasan Yang Jelas. Dengan Sertifikat Palsu Dari Pemerintah Bali Dan Dengan Pembayaran, Turis Dipaksa Untuk Melepaskan Bayi Penyu Ke Laut Lepas. Sebenarnya Lebih Baik Dilakukan Agar Mereka Tidak Terus Menderita. Murni Penipuan, Mereka Terus Berusaha Menguras Uang Anda. Sayangnya Saya Terjebak. Karma Buruk!”

review_text: Ten eerste beweert men dat je er alleen per boot kan komen. Onzin. Bij aankomst een hoop dieren in smerige te kleine kooien ofwel aan de ketting! trieste blik. Don't go there!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Awful people, who are called volunteers and don’t care about the poor turtles, are constantly trying to rip you off.
 
 We purchased the overly priced boat option to visit the conservatory. A volunteer took us around and pressurised to donate for baby turtles and buy several other things such as photos, souvenirs, drinks, tipping and so on..
 
 It was a sad environment where turtles were in a very dirty water and not being kept well. Not sure, if they were being released back to the water after they were being treated.
 
 Other poor animals were being kept in small and very dirty cages. An owl and an Tuscan were forcefully being given to tourists for taking photos. We’ve also been to the Bali Bird Park but over there the birds were being treated nicely and also were taken care of them properly.
 
 In summary, Deluang Sari Turtle Conservatory is a big scam!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Deluang Sari is a small delta in the Tanjung Benoa area of ​​Bali which is used by local residents as a turtle breeding ground. Located about 13 km from Ngurah Rai Airport, it takes about 15 minutes to get to Turtle Island Bali using a glass bottom boat. Around this location is a mangrove forest area that is protected by the state. The sea with white sandy beaches, with calm waves, is located facing the Benoa Harbor marine recreation center. Because it has an intact ecological system, clean beaches, and fertile mangrove forests, this place has been developed for sea turtle breeding. In addition, there are also restaurants, souvenir shops and other animal show attractions.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:

review_text: I don’t think any of the animals are happy here. The place seems more interested in making money than helping the animals. I’m torn, cos on one hand they’re supposedly ‘doing good’ but on the other, I don’t want to support this ‘business’ as the conditions of the animals look poor and I fear they’d have a better life in the wild, where they belong. Humans are probably their only danger.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Health and safety are clearly not priorities here. At the first turtle sighting, we were told we couldn’t take pictures unless we adopted a turtle and paid to release them into the sea.
 
 They then suggested we pet and feed (for a fee) the large turtles by hand. I hesitated as the turtles appeared to be swimming in their filth. The water conditions overall seemed unsanitary and unfit for the number of turtles in their care, but they assured me it was safe and encouraged my 4-year-old to feed the turtle by hand. Within minutes a turtle snapped at her hand, piercing it on both sides and causing her to bleed and cry profusely. Our guide left as a crowd of locals gathered but offered no help. I managed to wash her bloody hand in a dirty sink without soap. We rushed back to the boat immediately to see a doctor in Benoa.
 
 This “conservation” does not care about the health or safety of the turtles or people. Stay away.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
SCAM, SCAM, SCAM
 The guide was pushy and kept telling us to “adopt” a baby turtle to be released into the ocean. Told us it is Rp. 350,000 for each turtle and then I saw the cashier wrote Rp. 170,000 on his receipt book… this is common practice in Indonesia a long time ago but I did not expect it to still be happening and for it to be blatantly displayed.
 
 They said they help conserve the turtles but seeing the condition of the facilities, I doubt that this is happening. They said they helped collect the turtle eggs so that they have a more successful rate of hatching but I think they are just doing it so that they can make money by scamming people to “adopt” while overcharging tourists and pocketing the difference.
 
 Facilities are not run down and dirty. There is a snake but its mouth is taped shut.
 
 We came by a boat package so we didnt know that we will be taken to this specific place. There seems to be another turtle farm in the area that is nicer. Either way, I will not recommend taking the boat package or to visit this place.
 
 It’s a shame… really leaves a bad taste…

Kebun Binatang Mini Di Sana Sangat Tidak Nyaman, Hewan-Hewannya Dirantai Dan Mulutnya Dilakban Agar Wisatawan Bisa Menyentuh Mereka.

review_text: Tempat Terburuk Yang Pernah Kami Alami Di Bali. Siapa Pun Yang Masih Memiliki Sedikit Rasa Cinta Terhadap Hewan, Sebaiknya Menjauh Dari Tempat Ini. Sangat Kejam Bahwa Tempat Seperti Ini Masih Ada. Para Turis Dibujuk Dengan Cerita Bahwa Hewan-Hewan Hanya Dirawat Untuk Pengobatan. Beberapa Hewan Dipelihara Dalam Kandang Kosong Dan Tidak Layak, Burung-Burung Dirantai Di Kakinya. Kami Meninggalkan Tempat Ini Secepat Mungkin Dan Meminta Uang Kami Dikembalikan.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
We went today with family because of the good reviews but we were so disappointed. It’s very dirty, and poor. It felt like a scam. Online it says entry is free but it’s not even for locals. They pay 100.000 RP and foreigners pay 110.000 RP. To release the baby turtles you have to pay additional 500.000 RP. They have other animals too which look sad and sick. You have to pay additional if you wanna take pictures with them.
 There is no parking, respectively the way to the parking is too difficult for cars and the locals don’t allow you to drive there.
 
 All in all, don’t go. Waste of money and time. We’re just feeling bad for the animals and the people. I would not recommend going there.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: A bit of a tourist trap, you have to haggle for souvenirs. The turtles were kept in a medium size pool area. But they have other animals too for show. And I felt bad for the other animals. The snake's mouth was taped shut and kept in a box, so it can be paraded around for picture. The birds were in a large walk in cage, and also chained to the short post so they can't fly away freely. They said they're afraid the birds will fly away but they're freed in the evenings. I don't know if I believe it but regardless, really sad to see animals chained up and can't move at all (and the snake ofc) so humans can take pics with them.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Bagus ....

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We visited the place and the staff were very nice, they showed us all the turtles and we fed them seaweed. They also showed us different animals (toucans, snakes) and helped us pet them. We also paid 300k Indonesian Rupee ($25) to rescue a baby turtle and release it into the ocean (they breed these turtles themselves). It was such a good experience, and it felt really nice to help with something so remarkable. Certainly going to miss my little turtle. He was a fighter! Would definitely recommend this to anyone who wants to visit Bali! 5/5

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: DO NOT GO HERE. We were taken here by our driver and regretted it immediately. Firstly it is not an island and is accessible by land. There is absolutely no need to take the glass bottomed boat for $150. There is no conservation. All we saw were distressed animals being handed around by the host and then staff taking photos for money. Every animal looked sick and were not housed in their natural habitats. It was like a turtle graveyard. Turtles are kept in tiny plastic containers and the bigger turtles are piled on top of each other in a murky mud pit. It was devastating to see. There was a snake with its mouth taped shut, an owl chained to a perch all day and all for entertainment. Disgusting. We saw enough after 5 minutes and left after insisting the staff delete all the photos they took of us.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I would zero if that was an option.
 
 We were taken there by out your guide. We had no idea that it was all a lie. I genuinely believed the lady when she explained that it's a rescue centre for injured animals (be it turtles or anything else). I thought that the poor conditions in terms of low level of water in the bassin, rusty cages, etc was due to lack of funding for this centre as they explain that they only live through donations.
 
 Now reading the reviews and having done some research I realise that it's a scam. Some of the animals meant to be here temporarily have been here for a few months/years. With regards to the baby turtles and eggs they are not kept in the ideal conditions to allow them to survive in the wild after paying IDR 400K per turtle being released. It's a shame because it seemed like such a beautiful initiative 
 Proper Rehabilitation and Release Programs:
 - Turtles should be raised in conditions that closely mimic their natural habitat - Not even close to their natural habitat here since they live in shallow water bassins and are fed by humans
 - Rehabilitation programs should ensure turtles develop necessary survival skills before release - I can't see how they would acquire such skills in these conditions
 
 Habitat Protection:
 - Protect nesting beaches from development and human interference - They collect the eggs from the sand, move them into massive plastic containers. Once they have hatched they keep the babies in shallow water bassins and feed them.

review_text: Absolutely disgusting the way the animals are treated, why are the birds caged in hot conditions and no water, nocturnal birds made to sit on your shoulder for photos, set them free or sent to a sanctuary. My kids and I left very upset at the way they were treated. DO NOT ENCOURAGE THIS AND PAY $40 for tour, I thought I was going to see turtles in their natural habitat if we were lucky, no they are all kept in bath tub type enclosures and dirty water. My girls left crying.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Mengerikan! Hewan-hewan malang benar-benar menyedihkan. Piton mulutnya dililit lakban! Seekor hewan kecil (mirip musang) ditempatkan di kandang besi tanpa air di bawah panas yang sangat menyiksa; ia tidur langsung di atas jeruji besi—sebuah aib! Penyu-penyu berada di air yang kotor!
 Tidak layak, ini perangkap turis yang terlalu mahal; dalam 15 menit saja semuanya sudah selesai! Kami pergi dengan perasaan sedih melihat betapa manusia mengabaikan hewan-hewan tak berdaya demi uang!
 Bahkan tidak pantas mendapatkan satu bintang pun!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
We wilden een boottocht maken met een boot met glazen bodem zodat we hopelijk nog wat mooie vissen konden spotten.De boottocht was erg leuk om te doen, helaas zat er ook een bezoekje aan turtle island aan vast. Het enige goede aan dit eiland is, dat ze op hun manier goed bezig zijn om de schildpadden te redden. Schildpadden zitten in hele kleine, ondiepe basins waar ze niet in kunnen rondzwemmen.
 Je mag de schildpadden ook aanraken. (Geen dierenwelzijn)
 In een grote mangrove gedeelte zitten de fok schildpadden. Toeristen mogen hier in lopen en de schildpadden zeewier voeren.( Geen dierenwelzijn).
 
 Verder hebben ze andere dieren in kleine kooien zitten en halen ze een slang uit zijn hok om te kunnen aaien. ( Geen dierenwelzijn) En als je dan met ze praat dat dit echt not done is, halen ze hun schouders op en zeggen ze, we moeten de toeristen toch met iets lokken.
 
 Ik was heel erg snel daar weg en ben bij de boot op de andere gaan wachten.
 
 Als ze nu geen ruimte hadden om grotere basins te maken had ik het nog begrepen maar er is daar ruimte genoeg.
 
 Dierenwelzijn is op turtle island ver te zoeken.

review_text: this place was terrible the turtles were swimming in dirty water and had barley any room to move. none of the animals had food or water and or any sunlight. bird was in a small cage and was desperately trying to get out, also the owl was chained to a stick in the sunlight the poor thing wanted to sleep so bad didn’t have any darkness or anything worst experience ever do NOT come here

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This is a place where endangered animals are kept in captivity in small spaces to entertain people.
 
 A place where a snakes mouth can be taped shut.
 
 And where an obese so called 'volunteer' will beg for money because he claims to not have been paid but also because he hasn't eaten in 3 days.
 
 If only their focus was true, they would have far more visitors.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Had a visit to this “island”. boat ride was very relaxing and a good experience. Getting off at the island is a welcoming experience. Place does have plenty of turtles (some getting treated, and will be released to the wild as per our guide). Place needs a clean up for sure.
 
 There are few other birds. Not sure if those birds are injured or now living in captivity, but all live in rusty cages. ( personally feel like those birds can live in a better condition).
 
 There was a python in a cage where they offer you to take pictures with. Something I have noticed is that pythons mouth is taped and they handle the python in a harsh way.
 
 Hopefully this place will turnout to be a better place in the future, since truly it will be an amazing place if they really look in to saving animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Mortified, I was booked for a show and was offered a package deal to also go see Turtle island where they told us in was a conservation site. I have been to Turtle conservations before but this is nothing but the opposite.
 
 Teenage Turtles in shallow dirty tanks tanks the size of big sinks that allowed tourists to touch them, then the nightmare only got worse.... They took us towards the back where there were easily 20 plus full sized turtles in shallow cramped dirty conditions. They were obviously starving as they were struggling on top of each other so they can be fed this tiny bit of seaweed.
 
 I asked the guide will these turtles be released he said no, I asked how they got there in the first place (were any of them injured and being nursed back), he replied ' no I caught them and brought them here'. Then I asked how long have some of these turtles been here, he said some have been there for 20 years. My heart broke.
 
 Please do not go here, we have to fight and get this place shut down.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Boat ride there was ok but turtles are in captivity not in the wild. Do not think AU 250 ride there is worth it. Visit the Koral fine dining restaurant if you want to see lots of fishes.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
A tourist trap.
 
 Turtles are kept in small, dirty cages with little water. Other animals, like snakes, birds, and monkeys, are kept in cramped cages that look painful for the animals.
 
 And to top it off, the admission fee they're asking for is ridiculously high, at Rp800,000. There's nothing special offered for that price.
 
 Just save your money and skip this place. There are way better ways to see wildlife in Bali that are more ethical, like diving and observing animals in their natural habitats.

review_text:

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Ommit at all cost!
 The turtles in the water pit are having abrasions, joint inflammation and fungi patches. Living in the shallow mud, they support full body weight to move around and that leads to joint degeneration (as opposite to "flying" in the ocean). Sea turtles should at least live in the proper pools of water, but the owner changed only the posters around, instead of investing in the pools, or cages, or enrichment, despite hefty money they receive from the tours. Look around, if there are still 3 or 4 small pools, with just a few turtles inside, nothing changed since 2017!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Found ourselves here through a boating package. You get on a boat to get to this Island which is all part of your experience.
 
 The driver stops midway so you can feed the fish, which is a cool experience on its own. Then you arrive at Turtle Island (basically a part of nusa dua and not a true island), where you are allowed to get close and even touch the “rehabilitating” animals, this is where the horror starts, or at least to me it rings some alarms, this does not sound like a typical conservation place i have experienced in the past.
 
 The turtles are kept in small groups in very shallow water tanks, some tanks have only one turtle where as others have nearly ten, where they cannot properly move and have no access to food, some of the tanks are really dirty and broken where turtles can hurt themselves easily.
 
 Most of the big turtles struggle in the
 soiled water (open space water pit) and seemed to be in trouble. There was an option to buy a turtle to set it free, which did not seemed legit how it was communicated to us.
 
 There are other animals like iguanas, a cockatoo, an owl, a monkey with a very limited moving space, toucans, a bat, and a luwak - all in rusty, damaged enclosures, birds chained to a tree or a pole. Animals do not seem happy with their treatment and manhandling at all.
 
 For most of the birds, you can take them on your arm to make pictures but animals seem distressed, moving left and right, nibbling on your arm, really feel sorry for all these animals.
 
 Throughout the tour, the guide kept asking for donations and tips to help animals, but looking at the condition of this place and how animals are kept/treated, I wonder where the donations end up.
 
 There are some photographs who take your photos without asking and then become pushy to sell the prints for hefty price, claiming that the payment goes to the preservation, extension and maintenance of the conservation and for the well-being of the animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The big turtles were in a small dirty pool. Some turtles in even smaller concrete pools, but at least they had cleaner water. No plants, seaweed, rocks or other inspiration for them.
 A cockatoo was chained in a short leash sitting in the sun on. A big lizzard, toucan, a big bat and a snake was there for the tourist amusement for taking pictures. The cages were small and rusty, with just plain concrete floor. There was a young civet was in a tiny cage pacing back and forth restlessly. I told the staff, that this animal is very stressed and needs a bigger cage, preferably placed with the other civet. A very disturbing place to visit. This is supposed to be a turtle sanctuary .

review_text: مكان جميل.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Avoid this place at all costs; I found myself here through a boating/snorkeling package. The conditions are horrendous, tantamount to animal torture. Turtles struggled in dirty water, and tanks were nearly empty. The option to "buy" a turtle for release revealed questionable breeding practices. Pictures from years ago show no progress in their release claims. Cages housed a chained boa constrictor, iguanas, a cockatoo, a monkey limited to a few steps, toucans, a bat, and a luwak—all in rusty enclosures without water. Birds were shackled, and the lone monkey was tethered, allowed only limited movement. Throughout, a lady claimed to be a volunteer, relentlessly asking for money, falsely asserting it supports conservation. This operation is a disgrace and should be illegal.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Attrape touriste affreusement sale
 Traversée de 15 min a 1 000 000rp sachant qu’une excursion d’une journée entière à Nusa Penida avec transfert de l’hôtel, traversée, déjeuner et visite de l’île coûte 1 500 000rp.
 Sur place l’eau est tellement sale qu’on voit à peine les tortues lorsqu’elles nagent. C’est de la maltraitance.
 Il n’y avait pas de bébés tortues lorsque nous sommes venus.
 On a été très très lourdement invités à acheter des photos souvenir. Comme on n’en a pas pris, ils nous ont demandé de « au moins » faire un don pour l’association.
 La guide nous a confié qu’il n’y avait presque plus de touristes qui venaient. C’est bien normal !

review_text: Turtle Island Bali! A great experience for all! You have to get on a boat to get to this Island which is all part of your experience. The driver stops midway so you can feed the fish! This is a pretty cool experience itself! Then you arrive at Turtle Island and are allowed to get Up close and in the water with the turtles! You can feed the turtles, and all the other animals there. You get a guide to take you through the Island and we had the best guide! She let us spend time with the turtles and was very informative and insightful. We absolutely loved our visit here! Definitely worth a visit if you’re ever in Bali!

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sayang sekali kolam penyu benar-benar sangat kecil. Terasa seperti mereka dipenjara dan mengalami depresi. Namun, itu tetap lebih baik daripada mati tercekik oleh semua plastik yang mengapung di laut—sebuah kenyataan yang memalukan, laut seperti tempat sampah besar.
 Perjalanan perahu dari hotel hanya sekitar 10 menit, lalu kami diberi apa yang disebut sebagai “harga spesial” 600.000 rupiah untuk dua orang. Ini benar-benar seperti perampokan jika Anda tahu bahwa menyewa taksi seharian hanya sekitar 700.000 rupiah. Coba hitung sendiri.

review_text: Tanjung Benoa merupakan tempat wisata di Bali yang terkenal akan pantainya. Tempat ini juga merupakan surganya wahana air seperti banana boat, scuba diving, parasailing, rolling donut, seawalker, flying fish, snorkeling dll. Selain itu, terdapat pelayaran menuju Pulau Penyu tempat hidup dan penangkaran seekor kura-kura, ular, jalak bali, dan sebagainya.[4] Sehingga tidak salah kalau Tanjung Benoa dikenal sebagai pusat wisata bahari di Bali.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This was by far the worst state of animal cruelty I’ve seen. The turtles are in horrible conditions the other animals are in chains or cages with no water available, a snake had tape around its mouth and I asked if they ever take it off they told me at night apparently they do. I honestly wanted to grab every animal and take it home it made me so upset to see this poor animals!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
If you’re reading this before you go do NOT visit. Unfortunately me like many others I’ve read had this place included in a boating / snorkelling package. I knew as soon as we arrived this was animal torture and I felt so bad for these poor animals. Turtles are in dirty water, almost empty tanks of baby turtles, half of them are dead, later were told you can “buy” one to release it in the ocean (obviously why they are bred). Guide kept telling us they will release in a few weeks (all, not just the turtles) but I’ve just seen pictures from 1,3,5 years ago on here with the same animals I saw today Sep 2023.
 
 There was also: Boa constrictor, a chained iguana, a chained cockatoo, a chained monkey, x2 toucans, x1 bat, x1 luwak? Or similar. All the cages were like prison. Old rusty and empty. Not one animal had water. Kept reassuring us it was a rescue centre but there was paintings in the cages of what animal lived in there .. clearly it’s permanent home. Toucans looked really really unwell as did the luwak. I hope they die quickly and soon so they don’t have to live another day in torture. Poor things.
 
 Absolutely APPALLING! Guide asked for a tip at the end.
 
 The picture I’ve added when in live mode shows only 3 moving turtles. The rest are dead.

review_text:
Sangat mengerikan bagi hewan-hewan. Kandangnya sudah usang dan jauh terlalu kecil. Jauh dari yang disebut sebagai tempat pembiakan atau pusat penyelamatan—ini murni bisnis semata.
 Ditambah lagi ada kebun binatang pribadi kecil dengan seekor monyet yang dipelihara sendirian, mengguncang-guncang kandangnya dan berteriak mengekspresikan penderitaannya, serta hewan-hewan lain yang duduk lesu di dalam kandang dengan bulu yang kusam.
 Saya tidak pernah membayangkan keadaannya akan separah ini.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place was absolutely horrific. Balled my eyes out at first glance around. Working in rehabilitation I knew immediately this is not what it is advertised as. Conditions were shocking and the sadness on some of the animals faces was appalling. Complete neglect. The nonsense they tried to spew was ridiculous once they noticed my devastation. These animals will not be released and this is the worst form of a zoo. I left immediately and was in tears the entire way home.

review_text: Bestemt ikke pengene være! Vores chauffør foreslog os dette sted, men vi følte også grueligt røvrendt allerede undervejs på turen. Vi fik af vide vi skulle med “glass boat” og fodre fisk inden vi ankom til “turtle island”. Vi fik et par stykker toast hver, men der i vandet lå der fyldt med toast og ingen fisk ville spise. Glasbunden af båden fyldte under en kvadratmeter. På reservatet blev vi mødt af bassiner og pools med rigtig mange skildpadder i - hvilket vi var forarget over. Vi mistænkte med det samme at det ikke er et sted der hjælper skildpadder, men blot prøver at tjene penge. Vi havde en rigtig dårlig fornemmelse, og fortryder at vi har langt en god sum penge der. Bare lad være!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The other reviews baffle me. The turtles are rescued, rehabilitated, and usually released.
 Turtle eggs are saved from beaches, hatched out and safely released later.
 Most of the staff are volunteers who haven't been paid since covid.
 The zoo part is small (and unnecessary imho).
 But the turtles are definitely well-cared for. The tanks are not their natural environment, but a hospital is not ours either! We saw turtles recovering from shark attacks and fishing nets. Definitely better there, than dead in the ocean, and due to be released soon.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Please, PLEASE DO NOT VISIT OR ENCOURAGE THIS PLACE AT ALL! Animals are terribly abused. The staff threw stones and pinecones at a tiny monkey that was screeching. The animals are chained and caged. Turtles are kept in very dirty buckets. They say the baby Turtles are sleeping when the Turtle is actually dead. Animals are manhandled and abused. The business, although stating that it cares for the animals, simply wants money and does not care about the health of the animals. It is very sad to see how the animals are treated. It's extremely unhygienic as well. The staff are also racist and disrespectful towards the different people that visit. This is a disgusting place to visit as the employees mistreat the animals, are very rude, and the place itself is unhygienic and gross. Extremely saddening how this place does nothing but hurt the animals and exploit visitors.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Pengalaman yang SANGAT BURUK.
 Satu-satunya kesalahan kami adalah tidak mencari informasi dengan baik sebelum mengunjungi tempat ini (saya berharap siapa pun yang membaca ini akan mengurungkan niat untuk datang).
 Kami meminta seorang sopir untuk mengantar ke sana (tempat ini sebenarnya bisa dicapai dengan mobil), tetapi kami justru dibawa ke titik di mana kami diberitahu bahwa harus naik perahu (dengan biaya “murah” 70 euro per orang) untuk mencapai apa yang disebut sebagai suaka penyu ini.
 Setibanya di sana, yang kami rasakan hanyalah KESEDIHAN: penyu-penyu dipelihara dalam kondisi yang mengerikan, di kolam-kolam kecil dengan air yang kotor, dan hewan-hewan lain berada dalam kondisi yang bahkan lebih buruk.
 Anak-anak penyu dilepaskan ke laut dengan syarat membayar sekitar 20 euro per ekor (dikemas sebagai program “adopsi penyu dan lepaskan ke laut”, sebuah penipuan nyata dan kontradiksi lain dari tempat yang mengerikan ini).
 Ini adalah pengalaman buruk pertama—dan semoga yang terakhir—kami di Indonesia.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Tempat yang harus benar-benar dihindari! Ini adalah penjara bagi penyu dan semua hewan lain yang dikurung di dalamnya. Sama sekali bukan tempat penampungan penyu, dan tidak ada satu pun yang sesuai dengan apa yang dipromosikan sebagai “suaka penyu” atau Turtle Island.
 Penyu yang dilepaskan (hanya yang masih kecil) itu pun setelah membayar sejumlah uang, sementara semua penyu lainnya ditahan di sana seumur hidup.
 Seandainya kami membaca ulasan sebelumnya, kami pasti akan menghindarinya dengan segala cara. Pengalaman yang tidak ingin diulang dan sangat tidak disarankan bagi siapa pun yang berencana datang ke sana.

review_text: Honestly I don't know how this can be called ecotourism. This is more like exploitourism. The animals are captured from the wild and kept here for their profit. They told me they would release them after one month but I wonder who will monitor that. The presentation of this "zoo" is horrible. The animals are just kept in tiled enclosures or cages with nothing resembling their natural environment. How inhumane! After all this wasn't a fun or pleasant experience. We had to take off our shoes and walk around the dirty zoo. Please don't support this kind of business.

review_text: This place is a huge tourist trap! It’s not a conservation place whatsoever. Please don’t support the animal abuse. They’re kept in old dirty water in over crowded basins which arnt even filled up properly. The baby turtles were also dead, only a few were actually living. The “island” Is just mainland Bali. It’s not just turtles they’ve got other foreign animals that are chained up with no freedom. The lady leading “tour” had no experience or knowledge at all. She was also demanding for tips the entire time. Please don’t support this!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
My visit to Turtle Island was quite different from what I had anticipated. This place seems to be more of a sea-turtle collection spot rather than a natural habitat. The turtles are collected from the sea and displayed in pools for public viewing.
 
 The living conditions of these animals raise concerns, as they are confined to small pools, which seems far from ideal for their well-being. In addition to the turtles, other animals are exhibited in a manner reminiscent of a typical zoo.
 
 Overall, my experience at Turtle Island didn't align with my expectations. The place comes across more as a display of animals in captivity, rather than a preservation area where wildlife can thrive in their natural habitats. It's definitely something to consider if you're planning a visit.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Lovely island where they do turtle rehabilitation, and breeding.
 They have other animals to meet and see and can have photos with.
 Professional ones are taken and sold to help with the program. All the staff are volunteers, so if u want to tip them, they can get some money.
 They have a small cafe to buy cold drinks

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This place was a huge scam. You have to pay around 800k to go to a place full of animal abuse. Up to 5 or 6 turtles are kept in small tiled sinks about 1 square meter in size filled up to about 1 third.
 
 About another 10 “lucky” turtles get put in a somewhat big, muddy, pond that has been filled with seawater. The pond stunk a lot as well.
 The guide begs you along the way to pay 100k for some seaweed to feed the turtles which is waaaay too overpriced.
 
 After about 3 min of looking around with the guide we felt so disgusted that we skipped the other animals put into small cages and left.
 The island is also just a part of mainland bali but when you arrive it looks like an island due to the angle.
 
 They’ve just captured some wild turtles and put them on display in unhealthy conditions so that they can milk money from unsuspecting tourists.
 
 Shame to the people that gave this horrible place 5 stars.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Pengalaman yang mengerikan, saya belum bisa pulih dari apa yang saya lihat di “Pulau Penyu” yang katanya merupakan tempat perlindungan kesejahteraan…
 Kontak pertama saat kami tiba adalah langsung ditawari foto. Lalu… KEJUTAN BESAR!!!
 Empat sampai enam ekor penyu ditumpuk di sudut kolam mereka yang hampir kosong, airnya berwarna cokelat… dan kaki-kaki manusia menginjak-injak air untuk berpose, klik… 100.000. Ya, urat nadi di sini adalah… rupiah…
 Saya langsung berbalik arah dan kembali ke perahu. Di sana saya ditegur, dan melihat kemarahan di wajah saya, dia berkata… “Mereka berada di tangan yang baik.” Oh ya, benar… di tangan kebodohan manusia, tanpa rasa hormat terhadap kehidupan, begitu mudah mengendalikan hewan.
 Kesalahan kami… kami tidak membaca ULASAN APA PUN sebelumnya. Karena setelah kembali, saya menemukan berbagai ulasan dan foto yang diposting…
 Tragedi yang dialami semua hewan—dikurung (piton yang dimoncongnya dilakban)… Saya mohon Anda juga melihat situs mereka dan menentang situasi mengerikan ini… agar rasa hormat dapat diberikan kepada mereka… terima kasih.

review_text:
After been to the réhabilitation centre,where volonteers explain nicely,how they worked for the sake of the turtle,WE are expecting the.
 TURTLE ISLAND,WILL BE A FAIR sanctory....well there you see people bare feet in the turtle pool( so gross... the color of the water ,to get their stupide picture Taken...) 4/5 turtles,stacked in thé corner,to get food,....so the picture...IS Taken
 Turtles must be angry to accept thé food.....
 Were IS the welfare??? It IS a Big commercial situation...please stop doing it..
 WE turn black,as Quick WE did arrived......a man came After us,and insurded us, the turtles are in a good hand...
 Wich hand,???

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Not a place I will ever visit.
 The tortoises were in concreted tiled pools with nothing but just 1/3 water in it.
 There were 2 albino tortoises in 1 tank but 1 of the tortoise had bad injury on its neck. It was so so stressed that it was splashing and thrashing about in the tank.
 I was advised they were a pair, and they are placed to produce more eggs.
 It made me so mad and absolutely so helpless all at the same time.
 Sorry, I took no pictures bcz I was actually quite taken aback how they operate just to make some money.
 We got out of there less than 5mins and didn't even bother seeing other animals in the cages as we were advised.
 Sorry but I didn't believe they are actually helping the tortoises. Just another way to make money.
 If anyone has any concrete evidence, please share with me bcz I am open to rectify my opinion if I am in the wrong.

review_text:
Sudah tidak sebagus dulu, sepi.
 Ada uang 25rb saat sewa boat di benoa, bilangnya uang masuk pulau penyu.
 Tapi saat mendarat pulau penyu lagi, disuru beli tiket masuk lagi. gatau buat apa yg tadi 25rb diluar uang boat 410 ribu tadi (yg kata manajemen penyewaan boat sudah include masuk pulau Penyu).
 
 Di foto-foto oleh photografer setempat dan seperti dipaksa membeli foto. 2 foto 300ribu. Sejak kapan foto jadi 150 sekali cetak ukuran post card.
 
 Menjelaskan ttg pulau penyu, namun di sisipi bahasan “biasanya kami semua disini mengandalkan tip dr pengunjung untuk membeli makanan hewan2 disini.”
 
 Memangnya pemerintah Bali khususnya kabupaten yg mengelola, tidak memberi anggaran utk biaya pemeliharaan?

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Turtle island is very interesting because you get to see a various of turtles. Another thing that is good about this place it is that you get to see lots of types pf bird and a bat. The most scariest of bravest thing is touching the python. The python doesn’t bite but its mouth is still wrapped with a bit of tape and is trained to not bite. You will get to put the python on your shoulder if you want. You will also get a chance to have a bird on your hand. In the tour you will be able to take pictures and somebody else from the crew will to . In the end you can buy a picture or yourself for 150,000rp.
 
 - FY -

Animal cruelty being sold as conservation!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Очень маленькая территория, все посещение длилось не более 10 минут, вход 100.000 рупий с человека. Несколько ванн с маленькими черепахами, можно покормить больших черепах. Других животных мало - пара игуан, летучие мыши, пара попугаев, тукан и змея - и все. Почему-то несколько раз повторил, что 100К за вход - это дешево, и если бы мы приехали на лодке, а не на байке, то заплатили бы 1,5 млн.. Животные милые, некоторых можно подержать, но этих денег не стоит

review_text:
I was lead to believe this was a conservation of turtles. Not at all. It was a shameful place where turtles and other animals are living in terrible conditions.
 
 Also there is no need to take a boat there. You can get there by car. Our guide took us to an expensive boat place and we basically got scammed out of $80. I will never go back to this awful place. Make sure you visit the real conservatory and don’t let them take you by boat.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
SCAM ALERT!
 
 They wanted 50 USD per person.
 The average salary in Bali is 140-500 USD.
 They tried to tell us boat costs are different than car costs. But fuel here is less than a dollar.
 And charging so much you’d assume they could afford to keep animals properly, however as other reviews stated, the conditions are horrible.
 The kicker of it all? Charging money to release baby turtles!!!
 Avoid this scam at all costs!!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: As much as I love their idea of animal conservation, these animals aren't treated fairly. Birds chained to their branch in small enclosures, the snake had it's mouth taped shut, turtles yanked by tourists for photos and the bat shaken in order to have its wings open for a good photo. If you're all for animal rights I would not recommend.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Animal exploitation at its finest. If you care about the welfare of animals please avoid this place. The animals are living in such poor conditions, monkeys and birds chained up to poles, the turtles are in such small concrete boxes with hardly any room to move. I couldn’t believe how many turtles they fit in one small area, it was ridiculous. They had another turtle that lives in a small plastic tub. The volunteers claim the turtles and some other animals will be released but I don’t know what to believe after I’ve seen this place. They’ve got other animals living in tiny concrete enclosures, absolutely heartbreaking walking around there. Definitely a tourist trap, do your reasearch before you consider going here.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Przyjemność z odwiedzenia tego miejsca znikoma. Kupiliśmy bilet na pobliskiej plaży, łączący wizytę na Turtle Island oraz snorking. Szumna nazwa Turtle Island nie pasuje zupełnie do tego miejsca, pokazano nam kilka gatunków żółwi pływających w brodzikach, grupę osobników z sadzawki, której czystość można kwestionować oraz parę okazów ptactwa (większość pozamykana w klatkach lub jak papuga uwiązanych łańcuchem), przy których naciągnięci turyści mogą sobie zrobić zdjęcie. Odradzam.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Would not recommend going to turtle island if you’re remotely supportive of animal rights. Many turtles and other animals looked a bit drugged, a couple of the nocturnal animals looked particularly distressed ( no shade, awake in the middle of the day). While it’s cool to see a turtle so close up, we got the strong sense that none of them wanted to be there. We were all left with a bad feeling about this place.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
If you a marine biologist might be worth it. Covid19 hit this place pretfy hard
 
 Was closed for a while now open again. When you buy your tickets 100 usd for 2 people, they dont tell you till just before you get on the boat to leave there is an additional fee at the Island not included in the package price.
 
 As soon as you get off the boat there is someone who starts taking pictures of you which they try to sell you.
 
 Turtle Island has a pond area with about 20 turtles in it, a couple of tanks i guess is a petting area , a few birds , a fruit bat and a couple of lizards. That is what you will find there, yes you will get asked for tips

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Good place to visit for the first time as tourist, you get to directly get close or hold the turtles. Watersport people include this in their packages the boat that takes you there is said to be of a glass floor bus it's not rather than a very small rectangular glass floor window which is mostly covered with algae and obstructing the sea bed view that you were promised while selling the ticket. The species kept here are taken well care of. You can hold almost most of the species there. In the end when the friendly animal care taker who will ask you to donate money!!! The place is only good if you are an animal lover nothing wow here.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Nice place dedicated to turtle rescue and release. We didn't take our wallets because we were told not to, but as it's volunteer based, it wouldn't be bad to take a few IDR with you. It was 200K to release a baby turtle

review_text: Penipuan terhadap turis

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Fantastic experience to see and hear about the wonderful volunteers who protect the endangered turtles.
 They feed them with money that visitors donate.
 They show you them from young babies to the bigger ones. They return them to the sea when their shells are hard and they have much more of a chance of surviving from predators.
 You can hold them and feed them. They eat seaweed which they can pay for with money in donation box.
 Also have other animals such as birds and a big python you can hold. You can purchase bintans and soft drinks
 The place is so worth visiting
 Boats take you to island only short 10 minute trip.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Penipuan terhadap turis, harga terlalu mahal, dan penyiksaan hewan.
 Biayanya 40 dolar per orang hanya untuk naik perahu ke sebuah semenanjung kecil dan melihat hewan-hewan di dalam kandang yang terlalu kecil.
 Ada 2–3 ekor penyu di kolam berubin ukuran 2×2 meter dengan kedalaman air hanya sekitar 30 cm.
 Terlalu banyak penyu di kolam yang ukurannya jelas terlalu kecil.
 Kelelawar ditempatkan di kandang berukuran 2×2×2 meter tanpa kemungkinan untuk terbang dan dengan pencahayaan yang terlalu terang.
 Sangat menyedihkan tempat seperti ini bisa memiliki rating 4,1 bintang.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Ohhhh…. This is a tough one!
 The family debated some time if this was a tourist trap or just dedicated people with very little resources. One thing is sure, they have been hit hard by the ongoing recession.
 They seemed to have a plan for the turtles and the guide was really nice and easy to talk to.
 
 Therefore i choose to land on 4 stars being maybe a naive Norwegian, but at any rate this place will not bankrupt you, and it will also not blow you away. If you have soft spot for turtles (and birds, bats and lizards) this may be a place for you.
 
 If not, enjoy a couple of extra Bintangs and Pina Coladas.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
AVOID!
 Absolutely shameful this joints around in modern day society.
 Turtles kept in small holding pens - cracked shells .
 A load of codswobble from the guide that it's a conservation and breeding facility...- 200000 r to release a small hatchling (that's probably the best thing you can do to actually give a turtle a chance)
 Different birds on show very malnourished.
 Again Avoid and hopefully the joint closes .

review_text:
Turtle farm raising Olive Ridley turtles. Well maintained .. but reaching there through heavily congested choppy waters in a motor boat without life jackets is extremely scary.
 
 This route to the turtle farm is not recommended for the non observance of safety protocols by the local boatmen.
 
 One can reach the place by road too. Never use the boat option.

review_text: tempat yang tepat untuk tujuan wisata keluarga. Kita bisa belajar tentang konservasi penyu dan pentingnya kegiatan konservasi. Tidak hanya penyu saja yang bisa kita lihat tapi juga bisa bercengkrama dengan beberapa satwa lainnya yang sebagian besar sudah dijinakkan sepert ular phyton. Luasan area tidak begitu luas tapi cukuplah buat bersantai sejenak dengan suasana laut dan berfoto ria bersama keluarga. Pengelola aktif mendokumentasikan kegiatan kunjungan kita tapi untuk mendapatkan hasil fotonya kita harus membayar biaya yang cukup lumayan walaupun dananya sebagian digunakan untuk kegiatan konservasi.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: PLEASE DO NOT VISIT. The real Turtle Conservation and Education center is on Serangan Island. It is free entry because it is a genuine charity run by volunteers. Go by taxi over the toll road to get there. These other places are not run properly for best interest of the turtles. Remember, if they tell you there is an expensive boat ride involved, then its not the real turtle Island but just a petting zoo in part of Nusa Dua designed to overcharge tourists.. go to the proper charity on Serangan Island in a taxi by land bridge ( off toll road).

review_text: Do not fall for this tourist rubbish, possibly the worst tourist attraction I've ever seen. Marketed as turtle island when in fact it's not an island you just take a boat around a corner to the see the saddest turtles in a pool of dirty water under the guise of a sanctuary when clearly they've just captured some turtles to steal your cash. This was the trip that made me decide I will never return to Bali, every single person here is just trying to scam you.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Easily the worst place I have ever been. Led to believe this is a conservation place by tour guides etc. it is not. Do not contribute to this awful place. Turtles keep in tiny pools, a poor owl kept out in the sun. Aside from the hideous inhumanity of it all, the staff were also pushy and terrible. I feel ashamed to have gone here. Please do not visit.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
How do I give less than one star ?
 This is the worst thing I have ever seen , they make out that they are helping turtles but really it's a turtle death camp .
 50 odd turtles on one small bath area concrete filth for years and years and they don't even release them some of the turtles are 80 years old on the most disgusting environment as an Australian I recommend this to no one , I thought it might be a conservation park but boy was I wrong I should if asked for my money back
 Do not spend money here please

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Guide nya sih baik, kurang bersih untuk kolam penyu nya. Untuk foto-foto yang diambil oleh pihak sana dijual dengan harga selangit, dijanjikan dengan dikirim soft copy foto tapi ternyata tidak dikirimkan soft fila nya, alias tipu-tipu. Hati2 terhadap kepolosan mereka.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
TOURIST TRAP!!
 
 Please do your research before coming here.
 
 1. Its not a different island, as its connected to the main Bali island. I rent boat to to go there for RP. 500K, but I didn't know it was connected.
 2. I didn't do my research so I thought 'turtle Island' is where turtles are roaming around freely. But no they are kept in small muddy water. It was very sad to see. It was almost like unkept zoo. There were other animals too like monkey and bats and they were kept in a small cage as well.
 3.There was a snake and his mouth was being taped. His skin was roughed.
 4. There was an owl kept in the sun, there is a chain in his feet as well
 
 This is the worst place I ever came to Bali. T
 And sadly there is nothing I can do beside writing review.
 
 They shouldnt have commercialised this kind of business, please pleaseee just look for something else rather than using these animals for profit.
 
 So, if you visit Bali, DON'T come here.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is must be the saddest place in Bali I should have searched for this place before I go. I didn’t have plans for today, only thinking to bring my kids out for a boat ride.. When we arrived, I found that this is just another corner of Nusa Dua, not at all an island for viewing wild turtles that roam freely! It’s more like a private zoo that a group of people trying to make fortunes through capturing those animals. Though my kids enjoy a lot (they love all kinds of animals of course), I hope those animals can be released soon. I didn’t donate much because I really don’t know whom I’m really helping with. I totally don’t know why they have to keep so many turtles inside their place. I will never ever come back again. What I can do is to write reviews and blogs to give alert to more people .. What is worst, there are MORE this kind of places after I searching around this place with google map..

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
There are three species of sea turtle available in this place that have been grouped in pond for each species...
 Not so many turtles could be seen in the squared pond.. but a bigger pond has a sea turtle that is more than 80 years old.
 the trip from benoa beach took a boat around 15 minutes to get in the island, then looking around 15-30 minutes to see the turtle.

review_text:
PAK JON has been nothing but wonderful!!! HE TAKES AMAZING PHOTOS!!!
 I love his energy when giving the tour. The animals are all tamed and well taken care of throughout the pandemic.
 
 It’s sad that there are barely any visitors (only me and one other group the few hours I visited) so let’s visit this place more and while you’re at it give tips to the people here.

 Salah satu tempat yg menarik untuk dikunjungi di Bali.

review_text: Perjalanan naik perahu +-20 menit, bisa beri makan ikan juga karena air laut lumayan jernih. Guide ramah dan informatif. Ada penyu beberapa usia dan hewan lainnya deperti merak, iguana, ular dsb yang bisa diajak berfoto juga. Pantainya putih bersih bisa buat main

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Wisatawan sering juga menyebutnya sebagai pulau penyu. Selain destinasi water sport yg ada di tanjung benoa, para wisatawan juga dapat menikmati kunjungan ke pulau penyu ini. Pada saat datang ke tanjung benoa perlu menaiki speed boat terlebih dahulu. Dalam satu rombongan bisa memungkinkan hingga 8-10 orang utk sekali jalan dalam 1 boat tersebut. Tiket masuk kesini dan pembayaran boat langsung menjadi 1. Pada saat januari 2022 ini biaya per orang adalah 70rb. Banyak penyu disana. Namun juga tak hanya penyu namjn hewan lain seperti ular, kelelawar, dsb juga ada disana...

review_text:
Kalau naik.mobil pribadi, jalan masuknya kok sy rasa kurang layak ya. Sangat kecil. Dan ada jalan yg cukup berbahaya karena sebelah pas udah laut.
 Atau mungkin sy yg salah jalan ya? Sy sendiri kurang paham karena mengikuti google maps. Beruntung ada 1 penduduk yg berbaik hari mengantarkan kami ke sana.
 Di dalam penangkaran sendiri, para.staff dan.guide baik sekali memandu kami perkenalan penyu dan bbrp hewan lain
 Harga cukup terjangkau. Mungkin kalau jalan masuk diperbaiki dan hewan peliharaaan diperbanyak, sy yakin banyak turis yg akan berkunjung kesana

review_text:

 U can go here by buying trip from tanjung benoa beach.

 Every lovely tour...
