review_text:
Jika melihat lokasi tempat ini di peta, sebenarnya letaknya sangat dekat dengan titik penjemputan kami (sekitar 10 menit, maksimal 15 menit berjalan kaki!!!), meskipun kami dibawa berperahu cukup lama karena harus memutari semenanjung.
 Kadal dirantai dengan rantai, mulut piton dilakban, dan penyu hidup dalam kondisi yang Mengerikan. Satu-satunya hal positif yang saya lihat hanyalah kepiting kecil yang dengan lincah bersembunyi di dalam lubang-lubang mereka.
 Tempat penyiksaan hewan!!!

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Jangan datang!!
 Tolong jangan datang!!!!!!!!!!
 
 Tempat ini hanyalah lokasi untuk menipu orang demi menghasilkan Uang. Awalnya kami mengira akan pergi ke pantai dan melihat penyu yang hidup bebas bermain di habitat alaminya, tetapi kenyataannya mereka dikurung! Kami dibawa ke bangunan kecil buatan mereka sendiri yang berisi beberapa hewan, semuanya terperangkap, bahkan mulut ular pun diikat!
 
 Di negara ini memang orang perlu mencari uang, tetapi memanfaatkan hewan-hewan kecil untuk menghasilkan uang seperti ini—apakah kalian masih ingin datang???
 
 Saya sangat Menyesal datang ke sini… benar-benar menyesal.
 Tempat penipuan, manusia yang kejam.

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We thought we were going to an actual island that happened to have turtles on it. No, it’s a small area where turtles have been captured and placed in an obnoxiously small cage for the pleasure of tourists. I wouldn’t even call this a petting zoo, it’s a depressing prison for animals. The animals don’t look happy at all and I regret going to this place. You’re pressured to ‘donate’ and once there the guide tries to convince you to buy souvenirs. Overall, this is definitely a tourist trap, but not worth the money or moral crisis. Even if you don’t care about the treatment of animals, the amount of money you pay to get here - a total of a 1 hour trip (plus glass bottom tour of coral reef) is not even close to worth it. There were so many other things in Bali to see that are better and more affordable than this.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Should have done more research b4 gg. Feel cheated. Got a glass bottom boat ride, snorkel and turtle island package for 40usd. Not worth it. Turtle conservation does not look legitimate.super Pushy to buy photo for 10usd. Snake's mouth was taped and looked really angry, totally should not be used as photo taking prop. Handled roughly. Don't trust that our 3 mins guide was telling the truth abt volunteering and releasing the animals as cages had signs of animal name but she said the animal was rescued and will be released after 1 week?? Flying fox hated the crowds and was screaming angrily. Toucan tried to fly away but had really badly clipped wings. Opposums sleeping on the concrete floor and not in the natural habitat. Overall It was v unpleasant experience and the worst thing was we unknowingly supported it...

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
How much fun it is to get asked for a good tip every three minutes while getting a tour around the island. I will tell you now, the tip would be better if you keep quiet.
 Anyway the place was certainly not worth the admission price and a huge regret going, turtle s are stuck in a small pool and it hardly looks like a dream life for them.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa

Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terlalu mahal klo harus kesini, sewa perahu, masuk kedalam penangkaran bayar, minum kelapa juga mehong

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terakhir kesini belum sebagus sekarang... Terus dirawat dan dijaga kebersihannya

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Pengalaman Tidak Berkesan

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sangat senang untuk bisa memegang dan memberikan makan ke penyu-penyu yang lucu. Penangkaran ini tidak terlalu luas, tetapi bukan hanya ada penyu, juga ada hewan lain seperti kelelawar, ular, dan bunglon. Tetapi, sayangnya atraksi wisata yang ditawarkan masih kurang menarik karena hanya itu-itu saja. Pelayanan yang diberikan hanya sekedar diberikan makanan penyu dan diajak untuk berkeliling melihat hewan-hewan lain di kandang. Selain itu, diberi kesempatan juga untuk dapat memegang bayi penyu.
 Perjalanan menuju penangkaran penyu ini juga melalui kapal khusus agar kita bisa melihat ikan di dalam laut, tetapi karena laut yang berwarna cokelat jadi tidak terlalu kelihatan.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Bisa megang dan foto sama penyu melihat penangkarannya lihat baby penyu, penyu albino dan di dalam sini ga cuma ada penyu bisa foto dan melihat ular, burung dan hewan reptil lainnya

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Nyebrang pulau, cantik banyak penyu

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Ada hal menarik, tapi tidak semuanya sesuai harapan.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Avoid this place. Pretty sure this is a tourist trap and I doubt the turtles are kept there legally. Would not go back there.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Tempatnya cukup menarik, tapi masih banyak yang bisa diperbaiki.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Run down poor excuse for a sanctuary . A total rip off as a foreign tourist
 High pressure guides wanting nothing more than money 
 I will never go there again and neither should you

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I wished I had done more research before hand. It was a last minute decision to go as suggested by my private driver guide on our way to another destination. 
 
 The service provider show us a printed pictures of different activities, and we thought it was a good idea to do the Glass Boat Turtle Island trip with kids. They wanted to charge us IDR 500,000 per person (Around AUD $50 per person), then they managed to give us some discount which was still expensive. 
 
 The glass boat was a very old fishing boat with a tiny glass bottom that all we can see was muddy water and grass/ seaweed. The suppose 15 minutes trip on the boat ended up took around 45 minutes, with constant stopping to adjust the boat engine. The life jacket they handed over was so dirty and absolutely stunk.
 
 Once we get on the island, a so called Tour guide kept saying he is volunteering and its hard to get proper job here. The island itself was very disappointing with about 4 tanks of different turtles which you can not touch, but they have a large plastic one you can hold to take photo. There are maybe 7 other cages of animal, like owl, snake, chicken, peacock...etc. 
 
 The Tour guide kept mentioning wanting us to adopt the baby turtle and release them in the sea. Tried selling us very expensive sourveniors such as a small plastic turtle candle holder for AUD $40. Another guy kept taking photos of us then later was trying to sell the photos to us. I didnt agree to any of those as I did not carry any money on me, since my husband did not come on the boat with us I had him holding all our belongings. 
 
 The Tour guide was clearly unhappy that I didnt spend any extra money on the island. As we were leaving he said: "well, my job is done here and if you want to tip me". I didnt as I didnt have any money on me, and this guided tour should be included in the tour package that we have already paid for. So we all just thanked him as we were walking back to the boat. He completely ignored us and I can see him was fuming with anger. We left quickly as I felt uneasy since there were no other tourist at the time we went on the island. 
 
 On the other hand, after coming back from the trip, I did a search and found out you only need to pay IDR 500,000 PER BOAT, not per person. Totally being scammed !!! 
 
 AVOID !!! The animals were all treated badly, Turtles were squashed in tiny tanks, animal on chain in the cage.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Skildpadderne lider, dyrene er sat fast med lænker. Skildpadderne sulter og slås for at få mad, det er en turistfælde af værste skuffe.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: One of the most horrific and distressing trips we have ever been on. We were taken to this by a guide we had trusted as a spontaneous stop, as it was on route to another spot. I wish we had done a quick Google search before handing over 1.4m IDR for two people (should be mentioned, we were originally quoted 2.4m!!). The glass bottom boat was nothing but a fishing boat with a very small window in the bottom, through which you could only see seaweed and water. We were given a crust of bread to hurriedly feed the fish, of which we saw only one species. The island itself was nothing more than a trap with some incredibly sad looking animals either chained up or in tiny tanks. There were at least 10 large sea turtles in one horrifyingly small pool. All the animals were being handled by everyone and used for photo ops, and the staff were pestering for donations, as they claimed they were no longer receiving government support. Apparently the 1.4m IDR we had already forked out was nothing to do with the island, but who knows. We can’t believe that this relates to legitimate conservation work at all. The whole experience was awful, and we would urge everyone to avoid at all costs.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I wish I didn’t go. My family and I were expecting an actual island with wild turtles, however what we experienced looked like pure hell. Hundreds of turtles in very dirty sludgy water, but at least they could open their mouths to eat & had some ability to move around. 
 There were 4 beautiful birds - black cockatoo, Sulfur crested cockatoo, major Mitchell cockatoo, owl - all were chained to a pole with a very short (10cm) chain. They couldn’t fly even though the cage was large enough. 
 Another red parrot was in a tiny cage with a metal serving plate on top in the direct sun. It wouldn’t surprise me if this one has passed away by heat by now. 
 
 There was a yellow snake around a tree that my children looked at. My daughter was mortified that its mouth was taped shut. 
 
 They asked for donations saying they need money to care for the animals. Perhaps if it looked like there was some care involved, I may have donated but I’m not going to contribute to animal abuse. Four Paws and OIPA need to step in and save these animals and return them to safety.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Wir hatten dies über einen privaten Fahrer gebucht, der uns zum Ausgangspunkt brachte...wir wollten nur die Schildkröten sehen. Erst nachdem uns ein Angestellter 1,5 Mio IDR für 2 Personen abgenommen hatte durften wir aufs Boot. 1. Stop Fische mit Toastbrot füttern...dann weiter zu den Schildkröten.
 Es begrüsste und ein holprig deutschsprechender Guide, der uns das Center und die Tiere gezeigt und erklärt hat. Für 360k IDR adoptierten wir eine Babyturtle. Die älteren Schildkröten waren in verhältnismäßig winzigen Becken gesperrt. Man konnte Fotos mit Leguanen, Kakadus, Schlangen und Riesenfledermäuse machen. Die Tieren in Käfige eingesperrt. Für jedes Foto, das der Guide machte wollte er Geld, ausserdem bettelte er ständig um Geld. Während der Rückfahrt wurde das Boot angehalten, um die Babyturtle freizulassen.
 Alles in allem nicht Sehenswert. Normalerweise Anlage sofort schliessen

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I was not impressed with this place it was expensive for Bali boat trip was ok but didn’t like how the turtles and other animals were kept in small cages the snake had tape round its mouth which appeared to be left on we were asked if we wanted to feed the turtles extra cost and these were kept overcrowded in really smelly muddy shallow water guide also asked for a tip as he was a volunteer and had to pay for photos as well if you want to see turtles being properly looked after and being released back to the ocean visit
  Turtle Conservation And Education Centre admission is free they only ask for donations and you can release turtles back to the sea for a small fee would highly recommended this place

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
They scam you at every step! The "glass boat" is just a tiny piece of glass, and there are only a few animals, all kept in very poor conditions.
 
 They overcharge you by 10 times for everything, and the lady at the cafeteria counter even tried to scam us by adding extra charges to our bill, claiming it was a tax—she lied!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Same as everyone, I wish I read the reviews beforehand. I have a horrible feeling leaving that the animals are not cared for, or nursed back to health. The turtles are in cramped dirty sinks and don’t have enough room to swim, and the large 20 grown turtles are in a dirty pond. I kept asking if they’d be returned to the sea, the guide said yes, but upon leaving and doing my research they will be kept in there to die. The turtles are starving as feeding them seaweed they were all fighting each other to get to it. What made me most sad is the other animals they have chained up, a beautiful owl, toucans and bat all chained up. A drugged snake in a tiny cage. I asked if they can fly around, she said yes, but I doubt this very much. I have left feeling so very sad I contributed to these poor animals and I’m trying to find a petition or something that helps with better conditions and setting them free. DO NOT GO IF YOU CARE ABOUT ANIMALS.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Great place. They take good care of the turtles and other animals. Great educational value. No entrance price, just donation.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Just read all the reviews .. it’s all true . Paid 120 AUD for two to go in a small boat , literally 10 min ride to the “ island “. As soon as we got there, they put the hard word on you that they live on tips because govt stopped funding them after COVID. I was pretty annoyed by our guide from our accommodation as he recommended it . He did tell me though the story about only living on tips was BS. Then they take photos of you constantly with the poor animals and then guilt you into buying the photos for 15 bucks aud each . My 15 year old son felt really sorry for the animals , the turtles, the owl, snake , Toucan, and sadly a cockatoo in a cage , bats and lizards . Something about the place does not seem right ..

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Duped into visiting this place by our guide. We had wanted to visit the Turtle Conservation & Education Centre but he took us here instead. Only realised after the fact. DO NOT VISIT THIS PLACE. It’s horrific - turtles in tiny filthy conditions & animals in cages.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I wish I checked these reviews first. This is NOT a conservation sanctuary, they say this to justify what they do. None of these turtles need to be there, none are injured, none need rehabilitation. I feel horrible that I supported this abuse. I don't understand how people read these reviews, still go to the island, AND then say it wasn't that bad.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: If we as a collective can please stop going here ! it’s 100% a tourist trap for MONEY. It’s not kept well at all, run down . Clearly made up stories regarding the “ care “ of the animals . This is not a tour that should ever be promoted . What a terrible experience, waste of time , waste of money . A trap !! they just want your money .

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sangat tidak disarankan! Ini adalah perangkap turis paling memalukan di Bali!!
 
 Ini bukan pulau, melainkan sebuah tempat beberapa kilometer dari pantai wisata, dan bisa diakses dengan mobil.
 
 Harganya sangat mahal dan setelah tiba di lokasi Anda terus diminta membayar lagi dan lagi.
 
 Ini sama sekali bukan tempat penyelamatan hewan, melainkan seperti kuburan hewan!!!!
 
 – 15 ekor penyu di kolam berukuran 6m x 3m
 – Monyet diikat dan dikurung tanpa makanan
 – Bayi penyu mati
 – Penyu-penyu kelaparan
 – Burung-burung agresif
 
 Dan masih banyak lagi! Orang-orang yang bekerja di sana benar-benar penipu dan mengarang cerita apa saja. Sungguh memalukan.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: rehabilitation centre for injured wildlife, they do allow the holding of some of the animals. Very interesting, being able to be up so close to the giant turtles

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Gita breve su barca con un rettangolo di vetro da cui non si vede nulla perché il mare è molto torbido, ti danno del pane da lanciare a dei pesci che intravedi - cosa da non fare - e ti portano in una fantomatico clinica per tartarughe dove non sono curate ma vengono tenute in piccole vasche per i turisti. 
 Ci sono altri animali ovviamente in gabbia. Il tutto costa più di 60 euro per 2, tantissimo soprattutto per Bali.
 Per di più la "guida" ti dice di essere volontario e ti chiede soldi.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is not a turtle sanctuary, but a place where they mistreat animals for profit. Turtles are packed in. You are offered "seaweed" to feed them but it is really vegetation, pods, and dirt. There is a beautiful owl trapped in a small cage. Also bats, a turkey and iguana. These animals deserve to be free. There are some half dead turtle hatchlings that they will offer to set free for a price - cash or credit. The water on the way there is littered with trash. Please avoid.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We chose to go to 'Turtle Island' for our child to see the turtles and she cannot do any water sports but get disappointed eventually. First, the turtles are placed in spa-size buckets, and the others are in a place with dirty and minimal water. Next the lady keep on telling us to adopt the turtle to be released which is we dont mind, we paid 350k IDR for the adoption. It also gets annoying when she keeps on reminding you to tip her the whole time, when she was given tip, she asks for more to give to her friend. Lastly, they keep on taking photos and they get disappointed if you dont buy any, 1 photo costs 150k. We ended up getting just 2. It is not worth it, I do not think the place really is for the welfare of the turtles.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Omg this was such a horrible experience please don’t go there..this is so cruel and animal in enclosed space. It is nothing but a scam. I never felt such guilt visiting a place

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Looks like those animals aren’t there to be released, but for tourism. We paid 500.000 rp each to go the “island” which isn’t an island, by glass boat. They give you some bread to feed the fish. I thought that wasn’t a good sign, but I hoped the turtle place to be a proper sanctuary. The moment you step off the boat they start about donations. You can adopt a baby turtle to release it (350.000 rp for 1 turtle) There are a few small bassins with rescued turtles with broken shields and a few with baby turtles. Then you go to a pond with grown turtles. You can feed them seaweed (drop the seaweed in the water). A bucket seaweed: 100.000 rp. Somebody is making pictures of you feeding, which they try to sell you. After the turtles they bring out an owl which you can pet. While somebody takes the owl away, they bring you to another picture spot where they put a toucan on your arm. The animals are there to be released, she said. Somebody from my group asked why another toucan was in a cage. “Because this one is still wild and aggressive”, she answered. “Still”? So she suggested that this toucan still had to be tamed. Why? If you’re going to release is it, wild and aggressive is a good thing. There were also turkeys and a “sick” iguana in cages. The “adopted” baby turtle comes in a little plastic container, so you can release it from the glass boat on the way back. I didn’t hear any instructions like “try not to touch the turtle while releasing it”. So of course on the boat, people holding the baby in their hand. I don’t know much about turtles, but I think this can be damaging. I just don’t know if they’re really saving turtles. But the toucans and owl are surely not there to be released.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This place is horrendous.
 
 The state these animals are living in is just so sad - I left crying it was that bad.
 Turtles in tiny tanks,snakes mouth tied with sticky tape,birds chained up & a lizard in a tiny cage with a few bits of what it appeared to be grass desperately trying to get out.
 
 The dude then got us back on the boat to do the baby turtle release and took us to the main boating thoroughfare,stopped and said to let the turtles go….those baby turtle WILL NOT stand a chance with those boats going constantly in that area at the speeds they go.
 
 The lady was more concerned about making some money then answering our questions about the welfare of the animals.
 
 PLEASE DO NOT SUPPORT THIS BUSINESS & please don’t trust your “tour guides/drivers”. We were definitely misled.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Awful. Sad turtles in tiny tanks. Birds shackled and made to have photos. Constant asking for money. All up a very uncomfortable and gut wrenching experience.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I wish I’d read the reviews of this place. I thought it was a turtle sanctuary / conservation based. The conditions made me cry and still hours later I feel so conflicted that I went here with my family. This place is unethical, animals are not treated well and the place is so run down. I wanted to leave and was probably naive to the spiel initially that more money was needed to improve conditions. Birds in small cages, snake’s mouth taped over, turtles in dirty water. My heart breaks for what is an animal jail. 
 
 The Boat ride over on a glass bottom boat where the glass was so dirty you couldn’t see anything. Expensive scam that is basically torturing animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Zielig om de dieren zo klein opgesloten te zien zitten, midden in de hete zon. Je ziet dat ze ongelukkig zijn en onverzorgd. Hoog tijd dat dit ‘conservation Center’ dat alleen maar op geld uit is, sluit!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Avoid this place at all costs, the animal abuse is horrific.
 
 There is no animal welfare whatsoever. God knows how many fully grown adult turtles are living in a muddy puddle, they are literally living on top of each other.
 
 This place is designed to separate you from your money in as many ways as possible. Donate to (allegedly) adopt a baby turtle before it is released into the sea.?
 
 Don’t be fooled into a boat trip to “the island” from the Bintamg water sports centre.
 It’s actually on the same peninsula and can be reached by car. We couldn’t get out of there fast enough.
 
 This place deserves to be closed down immediately.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Ten eerste beweert men dat je hier alleen per boot kan komen. total scam.
 Je kan er gewoon met de auto komen. Dierenwelzijn staat hier helaas niet voorop. Ga hier nit naar toe. Dieren aan een ketting is niet meer van deze tijd!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: BIG SCAM, get you to buy everything, animals kept in awful conditions, glass bottom boat is an old boat with a tiny bit of glass bottom floating on 3 foot tall water

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Tourist scam - horrible environment. Trapped creatures. Irritating people. Turtles imprisoned for the term of their natural life

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I wish we had read the reviews before going….lesson learnt. We were expecting an island sanctuary with turtles roaming free in spacious water, it couldn’t have been further from the reality. Awful tanks with hardly any water - they claimed they were cleaning the tanks but apparently they say this to everyone. Turtles not moving at all, baby turtles are altogether in a very small pool, some moving but most not. The other animals are chained and caged, the snake is definitely drugged as it didn’t move at all when it was lugged out of its tiny cage. Just awful, I feel ashamed we paid to go and I was really upset by the state of the animals. Don’t be tricked like we were, use your money on something worthwhile.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The turtles seem well looked after and the guides knowledgeable but when told we could adopt one for 35K it was really 350K once the deed had been done. I complained but all of a sudden they couldn’t understand. I don’t like being scammed and I’m kicking myself for not just saying thanks but no thanks. It will bite them on the backside soon enough when they have no customers. Very poor show

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Absolutely horrendous place. Do not go here other than to release a baby turtle from a horrible fate. Animals in disgusting conditions. Adult turtles trapped there for life. Just more lying, bulls**t artist Balinese people looking to exploit you (and the animals) for money.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Unfortunately we thought we were going to an ethical place. This could not be more further away from the truth. The turtles seem like they’re in a normal sanctuary in comparison to others we have visited. But the other animals they have on display is very troubling. They have a bird on a chain. A boa snake, a massive bat, a Tuscan, Iguana and a Lewuk. All living under what appears to be inhuman conditions. Please do not support this place we regret it.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Schandalig! Je zal worden opgelicht! Het is klein, smerig en de beesten leven in een klein vuil basin. Het zal gesloten moeten worden, totale schande !

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Horrendous experience. Like many other reviewers, we unfortunately fell into this tourist trap via our friendly guide. Don’t go there. 2.4m IDR for 4 of us to take a glass bottom boat ride, initially to what felt like a rubbish dump just of the coast to feed the fish. I wouldn’t dip my toe in that water, let alone snorkel. We then drove through what can only be described as an accident waiting to happen. Parasailers, jet skiers, countless boats traveling to “turtle island”, speed boats tugging banana inflatables, etc. next to a main shipping lane and dumping ground for rubbish. When we got to turtle island, things got worse. 1. It’s not an island (it’s just the other side of the peninsula and mangroves), 2. It’s not a conservation spot (it was an ill kept farm or zoo), containing badly treated turtles all coupled together in the corner of the squalid half empty pond, and other ill looking and sad animals/birds. 3. The guides are apparently volunteers. Ours was inappropriate and keen to tell us that he was a volunteer over and over again - I won’t go into the details. We have him 100k to get out of the place. They also try and sell you the experience of releasing a turtle into the wild, but I doubt many would survive out in the rubbish dump that we drove through to get off the “island” and back to the horrendous beach area. Worst day of our holiday and such a shame.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Our boys (aged 12 and 14) love turtles so this was a must visit on our trip to Bali. We ended up here by mistake (by car) and reading the reviews we were worried that the boys would get a bad experience – but it turned out to be a good experience for the kids after all. Our guide seemed knowledgeable about the turtles, explained and answered all our questions. She said that all staff was volunteering and lived by the tips - not sure if this is the true - but left her with a decent tip anyways. 
 There were different kind of turtles, that were here to recuperate after incidences e.g. that they were caught in fishing nets or have been too close to a boat propeller. Some of them you can feed seaweed - I hope that they get enough - they all seemed extremely hungry. The baby turtles were absolutely adorable! There was an option to “adopt" a turtle to set it free - and you would get a certificate with your name on it.
 There are other animals like iguanas, a cockatoo, an owl, a monkey, toucans, a bat, and a luwak - all in small enclosures with a very limited moving space and no animal enrichment available – some of the birds were chained to a tree or a pole. This is surely not the best animal welfare conditions I’ve seen - but not the worst either! 
 We also visited the “Turtle Conservation and Education Centre” which is the governance owned and driven centre - for me it didn’t seem that the welfare of the turtles was taken more seriously at either places.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Totally discusted. So upset at how this establishment exists.
 Don’t go and support this business.
 It’s animal cruelty , 
 Discusting.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We were lured here by our driver on a whim and wish we’d read the reviews before going. Complete animal exploitation which was just awful to see. Couldn’t wait to get out of there. The host was like a circus ring master thrusting distressed animals at you to hold and pat whilst telling you how happy they were and all to make you pay money for the photos. Even though we declined, the host was still offering animals to us like they were his toys to play with. The turtles are in tiny plastic tanks permanently and the bigger turtles are literally piled on top of each other in a small outdoor dirty swamp. There was absolutely no conservation and no care for these precious animals. The staff followed us around, taking photos without asking and only wanted to delete them if we paid! We managed to delete them so they couldn’t use them in their advertising. DO NOT SUPPORT THIS ANIMAL CRUELTY.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
AVOID.
 I thought we were going out to see turtles in the wild. Instead we were taken to a place with nearly enough water for the turtles to swim in. It was absolutely depressing and the turtles were not thriving. There were other animals there too and they looked distressed especially the Luwak’s which are nocturnal and had nowhere to go to get out of the light. The bat that was also awake in the daylight. It was just awful and the massive snake was docile and obviously drugged. If you truly care about animals you would avoid this place.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terrible place!!! If they truly cared about animals, thry wouldn't keep them like that! Horrible stinky dirty shallow pools with warm disgusting water for large turtles. These turtle live in the fresh ocean water!!! I don't believe any of thr stories they told about conservation. The poor monkey in cage was chained and going crazy biting itself and eating its own poo. When we complained about poor monkey, they said it was injured and it would be released when it's older. I dont believe that for one second! Do not go!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Animal cruelty, I can’t believe a place like this can exist. 
 Scammers and the whole place is animal cruelty. 
 Overcrowded, extremely dirty tanks. Turtles in concrete tanks with people touching them. No animal conservation going on at all.
 Disgraceful! 
 The other animals there are in rusty, dirty enclosures and look like they are neglected. 
 Please do not go there! 
 Hopefully people read these reviews!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
DO NOTDOTHIS TOUR
 Deplorable conditions made me feel sick that I even went
 When asked questions just said he worked for the government
 Conditions were absolutely appalling Filthy cages cramped conditions and it cost 900000 rupiah for two people for the glass bottom boat ride and entrance for two people
 Do not believe the large sign saying eco tourism

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This place is a money making scam with distressing animal cruelty at the heart of the enterprise.
 
 Unfortunately we fell for this company as we wanted to see turtles in a hatchery, help out and release a turtle to the wild. However what we were greeted with before the boat trip to the 'turtle island' (which in reality was an island they put a turtle farm and tatty zoo on, not a natural turtle habitat in the slightest) were people trying to upsell us tickets to jet skiing, paragliding, water sports etc. which set the tone of the whole experience, a money grabbing exercise.
 
 When we got to the island there were loads of turtles of varying size and type but they were crammed into tiny pools and were clambering on top of each other. We paid IDR300K to release a baby turtle to the wild which we expected to be off the beach into the water like we have seen online. Instead you scoop one into a tiny plastic bowl and on your way back to the mainland the driver stops and tells you to drop in the middle of a shipping lane?! Definitely not the natural turtle habitat we were expecting to see surrounded by oil tankers and large boats, it was very sad to think the turtle was very unlikely to survive.
 
 There is also a zoo there which we didn't realise. It comprises of a few random animals chained up / caged for you to have pictures with. Zookeepers would manhandle the animals to be put on customers for photos including big snake, a toucan, a parrot with two chains round it's ankles, a mongoose in a cage where they could hardly move and a bat that is a nocturnal animal being kept in broad daylight. It felt so uncomfortable going round here and we were gutted we fell for this place from the adverts and website. We felt we contributed to the poor conditions these animals suffered. 
 
 We were also photographed without our knowledge and then they pressured us to buy these covert photographs at the end.
 
 I would recommend steering clear of this establishment as it will leave a bitter taste in your mouth.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
In terms of a turtle sanctuary I can see the merits if what our guide said was true. These are allegedly all rescued turtles who are eventually released back into the wild. Some have injuries from propellers and eating plastic. To concentrate on this effort is more than enough. Unfortunately I don’t believe there is any need to have the other animals in captivity as a further ‘tourist attraction’. You have to factor in that there are many different cultures and beliefs but my own personal opinion is the caging of these other animals whom are not going to be released is very cruel. I couldn’t find out for example how an Australian sulphur crested cockatoo found its way to this place to be chained to log in a dark cage.
 Again taking into account different cultures and expectations I’m guessing many would also be disappointed by the ‘glass bottom’ boat which is just an oblong plastic container with the bottom cut out and perspex sealed on the bottom. 
 As another commented the guide told us he was a volunteer and appreciated any tips. A volunteer in my country would not do that but this is not my country and this is obviously acceptable at the sanctuary. He only mentioned this once at the beginning and in fairness to him he did not mention tipping again. Visitors are encouraged to purchase something from the souvenir type stand of which 50 per cent of the sale is reinvested into the sanctuary. 
 I would not recommend this place mainly due to the poor conditions I believe the other animals are kept in. You do have to be mindful that what one person finds cruel and unacceptable such as myself is not necessarily the viewpoint of others and our guide seemed quite proud to show us the other exhibits. (As an aside I have seen some pretty horrific animal transportation methods here too that would not be tolerated in my country) A photographer is keen for visitors to purchase the photos he takes but if you take your own this is unnecessary.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Kami tiba secara tidak sengaja di bagian pulau ini dan akhirnya terjebak masuk ke kebun binatang yang tidak sehat ini karena para pemiliknya menghampiri kami saat mendengar kami berhenti dan parkir.
 Kami membayar 100 ribu untuk berdua tanpa ada harga yang tertera, dan di akhir kunjungan si “pemandu” masih meminta tip! Singkatnya, kami merasa benar-benar ditipu.
 Sekitar 30 ekor penyu malang yang hampir tidak bisa berenang di kolam kecil dengan air yang sangat kotor, serta beberapa hewan lain di dalam kandang yang jelas tidak terlihat bahagia.
 Intinya, jangan sekali-kali datang ke sini dan ikut berkontribusi pada praktik yang menyedihkan ini.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terrible tourist trap scam. Made a mistake not to check reviews before, which we always do and got charged a fortune to go to this horrible place with caged animals in poor conditions. The place is not even an island, some sort of slum. The whole place is a turtle farm, trying to pose as some conservation centre. We took 5 mins there and went out, just seeing turtes was more than enough. The guy showing around tried to scam uz even further by acting that he is a poor volunteer and the boss is not paying him. Avoid the place at all costs!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We had high expectations from this trip but should have done more research in advance. We enjoyed seeing the turtles and feeding them but once we moved on to see the animals we quickly realised it was animal cruelty, with animals in small cages/ chained up, serving the purpose of selling photos with them to tourists. The worst parts were a sad mongoose in a tiny cage and a parrot with chains on its leg. We’d paid before this to release a turtle, expecting to release it on to the beach, to find out we were releasing it into the sea off the boat. We’d been told on Gili Meno that some of their turtles were too small to be released so I don’t feel hopeful she will survive. Please steer clear and do more research like we wish we did.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Made it a whole 2 min and walked out..DO NOT GO IN. this place should be closed !!! Conditions are the worst. Poor animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Dari cara tur ini dipresentasikan, kami mengira akan dibawa ke sebuah pulau dengan penyu yang hidup bebas menggunakan perahu berlantai kaca. Kenyataannya, perahunya hanya memiliki kotak kecil untuk melihat dasar laut, itupun hampir tidak terlihat dan tidak ada apa pun untuk dilihat. Pulau yang dimaksud juga bukan benar-benar pulau, melainkan semacam kebun binatang mini dengan hewan-hewan di dalam kolam atau kandang.
 Mereka mengatakan ini adalah tempat penampungan dan hewan-hewan tersebut nantinya akan dilepas kembali setelah sembuh, tetapi dari berbagai foto saya menyadari bahwa hewan-hewan itu sudah berada di sana selama bertahun-tahun!
 Pengunjung diminta membeli suvenir dan foto dengan alasan untuk membantu biaya perawatan medis hewan, namun menurut saya itu sama sekali tidak benar.
 Biayanya sangat mahal (hampir 100 euro untuk dua orang) dan kekecewaannya sangat besar. Sebaiknya dihindari.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: HORRIBLE PRISON POUR ANIMAUX !!!! Tous enfermés dans des cages plus petites les unes que les autres. La tristesse à travers les yeux de tous les animaux !!! quel horreur !!! Ça devrait être interdit !! J’en ai mal au ventre !! Nous nous attendions pas à ça !! « Turtle Islands » quel mensonge !!!!!!!!!! Maltraitance des animaux sous les yeux de tout le monde c’est incroyable… en voyant tout ça … j’en suis écœurée. Comment peut on faire ça ????

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I do not like to leave a bad review but if had known what we were about to see, we would never have gone. As it was called Turtle Island, we were expecting to visit an island, but unfortunately it was just a dirty stretch of beach with too many speedboats and commercial shipping, not the place you would want to see a 'turtle conservation' area. And then it got worse, several shallow, dirty pools overcrowded with desperate looking turtles climbing over each other for some scraps of seaweed, and they tell us these beautiful creatures are protected...certainly not on this evidence. They then had other animals, a monkey, toucan, possum, iguana, and several cockrels in very small cages. Their main aim was to sell us photo's with these unfortunate animals and to sponsor a turtle. We declined both offers as we really didn't believe any of our money would be used to help these poor animals. To top it all off, we ordered a couple of beers, while waiting for the return boat (served to us with the bottle tops half off), and in less than an hour be both experienced chronic sickness for hours, we were really ill. PLEASE AVOID FOR SO MANY REASONS

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Mortified, I was booked for a show and was offered a package deal to also go see Turtle island where they told us in was a conservation site. I have been to Turtle conservations before but this is nothing but the opposite.
 
 Teenage Turtles in shallow dirty tanks tanks the size of big sinks that allowed tourists to touch them, then the nightmare only got worse.... They took us towards the back where there were easily 20 plus full sized turtles in shallow cramped dirty conditions. They were obviously starving as they were struggling on top of each other so they can be fed this tiny bit of seaweed.
 
 I asked the guide will these turtles be released he said no, I asked how they got there in the first place (were any of them injured and being nursed back), he replied ' no I caught them and brought them here'. Then I asked how long have some of these turtles been here, he said some have been there for 20 years. My heart broke.
 
 Please do not go here, we have to fight and get this place shut down.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: No worth anything. the Turtle are good, but to pay 1 Mil IDR for a speed boat ride to go to the island and click pics around the turtle - is not worth it.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I would not recommend this place, we felt so sorry for the turtles they are in small tanks with nothing in them. They said it was a conservation centre that's why we went. 
 It was expensive small and the guide spent the whole time trying to get money out of us for "conservation" to look after the turtles.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Earlier we visited Turtle Island with guests from India. Before leaving, we bought tickets at Tanjung Benoa. After that, we immediately took a small boat to the island. When we got there, the view was very beautiful and we were greeted by friendly guards. We were taken on a tour to see the animals on the island. That's what was interesting for us when we took a photo with the mother turtle (we were very impressed with the big turtle, he could sit on it and his binoculars were very strong enough to hold our weight, while drinking young coconut water

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This facility tries the rehabilitate injured turtles and birds. I know there are poor reviews. I feel bad for the keepers and the animals. The government cut off their funding. They went from 40 paid employees to 17 volunteers. They are just barely hanging on. We had a personal guide that was well informed which helped a lot.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Today was a nice experience because the tour guide showed obvious passion for his job as a volunteer for the turtles, birds, Lurwaks, bats and snakes. The island is caring for mostly injured turtles who have been brought in with plastic and boat injuries. They are released in less than 6 months. The enclosures were clean. Water is changed daily after feeds in the tanks. The oldest was 70 years. 3 different breeds; Hawksbill, the Olive turtle and the Green turtle. Well worth the experience as these dear creatures are being nursed back to health and our support gives them this chance.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Please don’t go here horrible they need to set all the turtles free hungry private owners investors place needs to be shut down. Found ourselves here through a boating package. You get on a boat to get to this Island which is all part of your experience you can drive there easier but they want you too see the water sports.
 
 Boat went from hotel Then you arrive at Turtle Island (basically a part of nusa dua and not a true island), where you are allowed to get close and even touch the “rehabilitating” animals, this is where the horror starts, or at least to me it rings some alarms, this does not sound like a typical conservation place i have experienced in the past.
 
 The turtles are kept in small groups in very shallow water tanks, some tanks have only one turtle where as others have nearly TWENTY TURTLES IN A BABY POOL, where they cannot properly move and have no access to food, some of the tanks are really dirty and broken where turtles can hurt themselves easily.
 
 Most of the big turtles struggle in the
 soiled water (open space water pit) and seemed to be in trouble. There was an option to buy a turtle to set it free, which did not seemed legit how it was communicated to us.
 
 There are other animals like iguanas, a cockatoo, an owl, a monkey with a very limited moving space, toucans, a bat, and a luwak - all in rusty, damaged enclosures, birds chained to a tree or a pole. Animals do not seem happy with their treatment and manhandling at all.
 
 For most of the birds, you can take them on your arm to make pictures but animals seem distressed, moving left and right, nibbling on your arm, really feel sorry for all these animals.
 
 Throughout the tour, they kept asking for donations and tips to help animals, but looking at the condition of this place and how animals are kept/treated, I wonder where the donations end up.
 
 There are some photographs who take your photos without asking and then become pushy to sell the prints for hefty price, claiming that the payment goes to the preservation, extension and maintenance of the conservation and for the well-being of the animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Dierenmishandeling! Ga hier niet naartoe. Ze mishandelen dieren alleen maar voor toeristen die ermee op de foto willen. Deze dieren horen vrij te leven!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
TAMBAKSARI TURTLE PARK & MINI ZOO is the correct name, a boat ride from Nusa Dua, well worth the visit, to see the different varieties of turtles, some of which are there to recuperate after incidences at sea, (caught in fishing nets etc) , there you can feed them seaweed and be in the water with them, to touch as they swim by.
 They have others in pools of different species, again you can touch them.
 Theres also a mini zoo, in which we got to hold a fruit bat and a small sized boa constrictor, birds, lewaks, lizards. They survive from donations to the sanctuary, please help them out by visiting.
 Be sure to go before the tide goes out or like us you will need to help push the boat back!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Guys, these guys are cheaters and robbers. They charge insane money for the trip which is awful.
 We paid for 1 hour awful experience 89 eur.
 I filed them to Bali tourist police. Hope the guys will need to close their business. They ruin Bali reputation

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Just don’t go here, going here will keep places like this going. Apart from sea turtles in dirty small bassins they keep some other animals like a bat, snake and monkey. Tourists can touch and tease them, and some of them happily did. Left the place within 5 mins after arriving. Ashamed we even went here. Trip was arranged by blue dolphin, which is also an overpriced scam.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
We just visited the so called Turtle Island yesterday. What a great disappointment. 
 We paid like 100$ for a short boat ride to the so called turtle island.
 We were so sure it was an island where turtles were in their natural environment and free. 
  On reaching there we found it is just a small ill kept farm. The turtles were in the tank for you to see and touch. Too many turtles in a small place. The staff will bring out some sea weed to be fed by us. 
 Not sure if this was the only meal the turtles were getting fed by visitors. They all seemed extremely hungry. 
 
 In small cages of their own, they also had like one Iguana , bats , poorly fed birds, and also a snake . 
 These will be brought out to take pictures if you please. 
 The staff that were showing us around were telling us they were volunteers and don’t get paid . Not sure how much of it is true .

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
DO. NOT. GO
 We were scammed by the price (agreed to amount and then charged US dollars and not AU) ..the ride over was short..and very expensive..and had to pay donations and asked to pay for photos and tips which we declined as we did not like how the animals were being "cared for" on this island. Everyone sounded like a made up story to sell to tourists.. all lies.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sebaiknya dihindari!
 Tidak ada, benar-benar tidak ada yang menarik!
 Perangkap turis yang sesungguhnya!
 Sangat Mahal untuk tidak melihat apa-apa, kecuali beberapa penyu malang di kolam-kolam kecil.
 Simpan uang Anda, masih banyak hal indah yang bisa dilihat di Bali!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Wish we had read the reviews so we could have skipped this sad experience. Birds chained to their perches, what looked like too many turtles in a pond, guides complaining they aren’t getting paid by the owner.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Sebaiknya dihindari!
 Tidak ada, benar-benar tidak ada yang menarik!
 Perangkap turis yang sesungguhnya!
 Sangat Mahal untuk tidak melihat apa-apa, kecuali beberapa penyu malang di kolam-kolam kecil.
 Simpan uang Anda, masih banyak hal indah yang bisa dilihat di Bali!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is abhorrent place. I am traumatised from what I've seen. This place claims to be a safe haven for animals, instead it is a jail that should be closed down immediately. No one should come here.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Absolutely horrible!! do not go, there is no conservation at all the tanks the turtles are held are small and filthy, the guide tells you it’s all good the turtles are released after breeding which she then said after more than 100 years. The poor snakes have their mouth sticky taped so no one gets bitten. It’s a horrid tourist trap exploiting cruelty to the poor animals. DON’T GO!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Total waste of money and time as there's nothing in the turtle island besides few turtles in small water pool.. and one more thing is glass boat tour, which is also utter waster as you dont see fish clearly and its expensive.
 Im not sure about other activities as i didnt try.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Traumatised for life.
 Animals living in abhorrent conditions so someone can make a buck from unsuspecting tourists.
 TripAdvisor should allow zero or negative stars for places like this.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Never come here, the conditions are awful. You walk in and they tell you about this exclusive boat ride to “Turtle Island.” This wasn’t listed in our itinerary from Viator, only “Beach Water Sports,” otherwise we would have done our research and avoided this place. When you get there, you quickly witness the deplorable conditions the animals are living in, yet they tell you it’s a “small hospital” for animals (with no veterinarians in sight). You’re given the option to help baby turtles navigate their way to the ocean. No, anyone who “adopts” them will be driven to a center of boats on the water and be asked to plop them in. After doing some research a few days before, I KNEW about businesses picking them right back up and selling them off again. This is what that looked like to me. Don’t support this place! I wish I knew who to report the cruelty of ENDANGERED animals to. I also saw a snake with his mouth taped shut, a cocky with her leg chained, bats in nasty tiny cages, etc. I refused to buy a picture because I felt awful having a “fun picture frame” around a depressing scene. I feel sick.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Boat ride to the “island” is the only good thing about the tour. 
 The main area was full of big old turtles slumped with their eyes closed not moving I a slimed filled area they said they were changing the water. The tour guide gave a speel about being a volunteer and not getting any money. The little enclosures with ‘rescued’ turtle and baby turtles ( some dead ) was enough for us. 
 When the guide then showed us the cages with monkeys, big colourful birds in a cage, a cocky chained to a post, it revealed a zoo with hideous conditions. 
 As we made a hasty head back to the boat they tried to sell us souvenirs and the idea of adopting a baby turtle to be released in the ocean…. And upon payment you receive a certificate of authenticity. 
 In short - don’t go here. It is creepy & gross. 
 A Transparent Rort with lies about saving the endangered turtles.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Had a lovely time at Turtle Island, got there by boat.
 The boat took us out to feed the pretty fish with bread, it was a glass bottom boat so we had a brilliant view of the fish and onto Turtle Island.
 We were shown the rescued turtles and got to touch them, we were also shown other animals that had also been rescued. By buying a photo taken of us taken there we are helping the turtles.
 Very enjoyable, lovely weather and something we have never done before.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place should be shut down. I am absolutely horrified that we paid to see what we were told was a rehabilitation place for turtles. It is nothing more than animal cruelty in a filthy, tiny 'zoo'. It is so sad. The animals looked so distressed and the turtles are in filthy water and being aquatic animals, it is not even enough water. DO NOT GO HERE.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: NO NO NO NO NOOOOO….Do not come to turtle island! Save your money and go to TURTLE CONSERVATION AND EDUCATION CENTER instead that’s FREE, your driver will want to take you to turtle island to make a disgusting commission! This is the worst place I’ve been to in my whole life…what a scam, it’s not even an island! It’s NUSA DUA, they make you pay an expensive boat ride from NUSA DUA TO NUSA DUA wtf…it’s a lawless zoo with HORRIBLE unsanitary conditions. Besides supporting people that capture these animals and give them the worst treatment, exploit them for entertainment they pressure you to “adopt” a turtle LOL to pay for the “food supply” the food is literally algae that floats in the ocean. I asked so many questions and they all gave me different answers, truth is, they will never release the turtles. And some of the baby turtles were dead floating btw..They are straight up liars and tell you they are volunteers (they are hustlers that will hustle you for money until you leave), and that they save the turtles it’s all lies! Read the reviews first.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
My driver suggested going to this place as I was visiting canggu and drive me here as part of a partial tour. I didn't look up reviews about the turtle island so I was shocked when I arrived and one of the salesmen quoted $87 (1 million Rupiah)for a 'glass bottom boat' ride to the island. I felt bad that my driver had driven me all the way here so I thought I might as well go for it. I suppose because I was solo I had to pay the minimum for two people ( would have been $44 approx per person maybe if it had been a pair). The boat ride was pretty, they had given me stale bread to feed the fishes but I couldn't see any on the journey to the island.
 
 Now the hideous part. The turtle island that they call it, I was brought to a rundown place they called the conservatory. The tour guide rushed through the explanations of how the turtles hatch and there was no real passion or interest in what he was telling me. Yeah you get to feed the turtles with rotting Seaweed for some photo op.
 
 The worst part of it all is that they call it a turtle conservatory but somehow there is a random assortment of animals in the place and there is no reason any of them are even there. In individual rusty cages are these animals: cockatoo, bats, iguana, peacock with chickens. And the very worst of all is a snake WITH ITS MOUTH TAPED SHUT. They take photos of you then rush to get you to buy the photo (luckily I declined)
 
 Please do not go to this place, for you are only supporting the cruelty of the animals here and are being terribly scammed of your money. Be smarter than me and remember it's okay to say no, no matter how persistent they are and how rude they end up being to you. Stop patronising this terrible tourist trap! ⚠️BIG WARNING ⚠️

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
We had visited a jewellery making workshop which finished earlier than expected so our driver suggested we go to Turtle Island. We didn't have Internet on our phones as we use WiFi so asked him about it. He said we'd see turtle eggs on the beach, turtles in the sea and some in a sanctuary. How wrong he was...
 
 Firstly, the turtle eggs "on the beach" have been stolen from the beach and placed in a small heap of sand inside a concrete area. There are no turtles in the sea, they're in tiny concrete "tanks" which barely cover their backs so they can't swim. We were told they were rescues until we realised each tank goes up in age... newborns, 1 month, 4 months, 6 months, 3 years etc etc until we were shown some turtles that are 25 years plus. The 'guide' told us they'd be released into the wild next week but that simply can't be true... how will they replace the animals in the tank that says they're 3 years old if they've all been released!? The guide then showed us his breeding programme. 30 young and adult female turtles with 1 ginormous male. A few of the turtles had what look like tumours on their heads... he said they'd eaten plastic straws in the wild and these were injuries from those but later told us these turtles were born here and used for breeding. 
 
 We were invited / intimidated to pay 300idr each to release a baby turtle straight into the sea. When I told the guide I already knew baby turtles need to walk for miles on the sand in order to know their way back otherwise they drown, he laughed and told me that for every 100 released, hopefully 3 will survive rather than drown. We declined his offer to release any and he seemed quite angry. 
 
 We were also shown animals in small cages, chained to sticks with horrendous living conditions. The guide told us sob stories about how each 1 had been rescued last week but I've been through photos on Trip Advisor and noticed the exact same animals have been there for years. 
 
 The guide said he's been a volunteer for 25 years and hasn't worked for the last 3 years because of Covid19, he said he'd only started working again 2 weeks ago and the turtles have been starving. I'm not sure how long he can use Covid19 as the reason the turtles are so hungry. He wanted us to give him money "to buy turtle food" - which by the way is rotten dead sea grass, not the fresh green sea grass you'll see if you go snorkelling in the sea. The breeding area was absolutely filthy brown and had huge turtle poos floating all over the place. The turtle shells were incredibly dirty as well. The guide had an answer for all of our questions "the turtles are cleaned tomorrow" "the tank is cleaned tonight at 6pm" "the doctor comes to see the turtles tomorrow" "the doctor will microchip the turtles next week before we release them". He deserved an Oscar for lying. 
 
 The guide showed us a snake on the way out which had its mouth taped so tightly shut its mouth was white and swollen. He said it was rescued a few days ago but when I asked what it will eat, he pointed to the live chickens and said they throw 1 in every week... but I thought you'd only just rescued the snake a few days ago!? Hmm...
 
 Towards the end of the "tour" the guide asked me to pay him money to feed his family. I'd rather have paid him to unlock all the chains on the animals legs, leave the doors open and take the turtles back to the beach. 
 
 Absolutely horrendous place that needs closing down. 
 
 I would have paid the guide to release all of the animals back into the wild where they belong.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Awful experience got taken here after a snorkelling tour and would NEVER have gone. Like multiple people, I wish I’d looked at the reviews before we went. Overcrowded, awful conditions. The guide said they release them once they’ve recovered bur I highly doubt it. The tipping point was the poor snake with a plastic band round it, and then the cockatoo with a chain on its “broken” leg. They asked for tips saying they’re volunteers but the whole thing felt like a scam.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Ga niet naar het schildpadden eiland. Veel te kleine hokken! De slangen hun bek is dicht getaped en dan mag je ermee op de foto! Dit moet stoppen! Ik ging in tranen hier weg.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: 那裡的農場環境非常差，海龜是被圈養的，只有小小的水池，拍照到後面我們觀察到，所有的動物看起來都沒有什麼精神，狀況非常糟糕，還會以愛心知名要求你購買照片。我們起初是因為KKDAY上的行程介紹來這裡，但商家要求我們搭乘昂貴的小船才能來到這裡，是個不愉快的體驗，且為小動物們感到惋惜和難過。

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Attrape-touristes.
 Ce n'est pas une île mais accès en bateau très cher.
 Conditions de vie déplorables pour les animaux.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Just don't....
 Awful depressing place, from start to finish was awful. Please avoid this place. Read the reviews before considering and just forget about going. Do something else, anything!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The place is really corrupted. People took you around to see all the animals with pictures. Every picture would cost you iDR 150k. Save the little turtle and release back to the sea would cost USD 30. I don’t know why we have to pay to release the baby turtle to the sea. Isn’t it their work? The boat tickets is very much negotiable. This place is not for saving turtle but for squeezing tourists!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Please do not visit here. 
 This is NOT a turtle conservation area. 
 It is a sickening, depressing place where turtles, birds and a snake are kept in the most awful conditions. 
 The snake is kept in a bare, perspex cage. No branches, no greenery, nothing. It is there to entertain tourists who can pay to be photographed with it. To prevent it from biting, it has a 1cm wide rigid plastic band around its mouth. This has restricted blood flow so the mouth is swollen, engorged and ulcerated. I can’t imagine it is ever removed for the snake to eat - I suspect they allow it to die then replace with another snake. It must be experiencing unbearable pain! 
 Such an upsetting, depressing experience. The only thing keeping this awful place going is cash from unsuspecting tourists. Please do not go here. 
 I have given it one star because zero stars is not an option and a review cannot be written.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Absolutely horrible. The ‘conservation’ showed lack of interest in supporting the sustainability and longevity of turtles or any other animals. Enclosures were cages or animals were restricted with chains. The enclosures were dirty and had no living things to sustain life. E.I branched or trees for the birds or monkey. The fully grown Turtles were kept in a 5x5 cement pond with dirty water. Shallow enough that it would only come to an adults mid calf. I counted at least 12 turtles in the pond. I feel disgusted that I spent money supporting this tourist attraction.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Heb toch enigzins mijn bedenkingen bij die adres. Overigens werd er ook mede door mijn chauffeur gezegd dat je er alleen per boot kan komen. Onzin. Gewoon weer maffia er moet op verdiend worden 
 
 Schildpad adopteren kan 250.000 echter wordt niet in je bijzijn los gelaten vandaar mij bedenkingen

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Appauling place, huge tourist trap. Animal cruelty and abuse to the extreme.
 Employees intimadating tourists to give money as they are poor and have no income.
 Very unprofessional tourist guides, animals suffering everywhere. Turtles kept in a tiny makeshift pool with limited water. Many dead hatchlings floating in the filthy pond, Australian Cockatoo chained to a pole on the floor next to a huge python.
 
 Should be closed down immediately

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: DISGUSTING place, it was advertised as a rescue/ conservation place to us, a clear TOURIST TRAP, that unfortunately I fell for, these animals are actually inprisoned here for their lives until they die, in very poor conditions, small cages and enclosures, dirty, completely unnatural, we would NOT have gone if we researched first, which I now regret not doing. They are liars and know what to say with a sob story of pretending to be a volunteer with no income relying on tourists tips, pretending that all these animals are rescued and will be released eventually, the whole thing is ANIMAL CRUELTY, a complete SCAM, it was so traumatic going here and I will never forget what I've seen, NEVER GO HERE and be aware of all animal orientated places and events in Bali and Indonesia, they cannot be trusted. Makes me feel so sick and angry and sad.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: It was a wonderful experince at bali. The turtle were about more than 100 years old and having various category of turtles in the island.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place is absolutely sickening and infuriating. The turtle island people scam tourists by pretending they rescue turtles and other animals to rehabilitate them before releasing them back into the wild, but really they just keep them trapped in disgusting conditions and profit off pretending they are rescued animals that are going be released. Turtle island is just ANIMAL ABUSE, and nothing more. The animals have been kidnapped to keep in this turtle petting zoo are none of the animals are going to be released. The man there will also expect a big tip and coerce you to buy a photo with the turtles and souveniers. Turtle island is a big scam and I am one of the tourists that was tricked into it. It is disgusting. The giant turtles are all crammed into a small artificial concrete pond. It breaks my heart. The turtles look miserable and mistreated and barely have room to move. All the other animals are in tiny dirty cages and they are stuck there to suffer until they die. The animals are chained in their cages, and you can see how abused they are. No animal is treated right or getting released, it is literally a prison pretending to be a "rescue center". NEVER GO HERE it is traumatizing. I cried so many tears for the poor creatures there. Do not fall for this sick tourist trap. The things I saw will scar me for life - it was so horrendous.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Terrible place where turtles are crammed in a tiny dirty pool.
 They chain up parrots and a monkey, and lock other animals in cages with no green, branches or anything. It's the most depressing place I've been to. :( I wish I researched it beforehand- and did not support this place.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Absolutely horrible experience DO NOT GO!
 The poor turtles and other animals living in this love have such a sad existence. The place is horrible, all the staff clam to be ‘ volunteers’ and justify the animals welfare which I didn’t believe for a second, a scam and full of $&@. 
 Wish I could have taken all the animals and saved them from such a disgusting place Jay they have to call home

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Shocking. Deplorable conditions. The “volunteer” pretended she couldn’t understand my questions about how they rescue the turtles and when do they get released back into the wild. Snake with rope around its mouth. Birds in chains. Makes me sick we even went. $300 for a family of 5. Do not do this tour.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Was a good experience for the kids. But as they have many sanctuaries opened on the island it a bit of a mess up. Shoul have only 1 and they can make it look even better. The cost of items on the island is a ripoff.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
WARNING DO NOT GO THERE !!!
 We were guided by a guy who said he had worked there as a volunteer for 10 years and does get pay, that he relies on money given to him by tourists. We were told the turles would released soon as the damage to their shells or flippers was nearly healed, didn't believd that, if they did there wouldn't any turtles to show the tourists. One cage held a small monkey it was dirty and decripitated, the monkey had a dog collar around it's waist and was chained, we were told it is let off the chain at night, (once again not believed) he reckoned that during the day it could get out through the large gap at the bottom of the wired door, can't see what difference day or night makes, the holes not going to shrink just because it gets dark. The tank where adult turtles were, looked over crowded, some of their shells felt slimy, obvious not keep clean. There was also 2 birds chained to perches. At the end of the 30 min tour while in a cage with a bat the guide directed us to stand close to the wall so that "his boss" would not see us give him money, he asked to be paid 100,000IR each as a tip. He was loud, overbearing, we felt intimated we just paid him what he asked for to get him away from us. Place was disgusting.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Best way to improve this facility would be to close it.
 The facilities are just a bunch of concrete ponds with turtles in. No attempt to replicate a natural environment for supposed protection & breeding of turtles.
 There are birds, monkeys, snakes & lizards in decrepard & dirty cages. What do these have to do with turtles. Just a rip off at the expense of the turtles.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Not an experience. Disappointing. Dirty reptile zoo like atmosphere. Pushy staff trying to make you buy a picture of a sea turtle that does not look well cared for.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Sad to see the turtles stuck in pens. We were told these were rescued and would be released back into the wild but this seems unlikely as they there would be no tourist attraction. To top it off the staff literally requested a 300000 idr tip!! Can you believe it, the guy specifically asked to be given it in private

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The moment one visits Nusa Dua beach, your tour operator or local will insists on taking a boat ride to Turtle Island quoting USD 60 per person. Just say you are not interested & price will straight a way drop to USD 30 per person.
 Even at this price, the visit is a waste.
 It’s a small turtle breeding cum rescue centre which is claimed to be managed by some NGO. To attract kids, some birds, bat, iguana are also kept.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Turtle island was underwhelming, I liked to learn about the turtles and it was great to have a tour guide from the moment we stepped onto the island but we did feel sorry for all the animals there. I understand that standards to animals habitats are different around the world, but we felt like there was too many turtles in one area. It was also sad to see the monkey and bird tied up. We asked about why the monkey was chained and was told it was only for a year given that it was seperated from its mother and they have "rescued" it. There was also tiny little kittens in a cage which I wanted to take home, I'm unsure as to what the purpose was for them to be there in such a tiny cage. I did really enjoy the pyhthon, lizard and tucan but was mortified to be told they feed live chickens to the python. I wouldn't go back here but I'm happy I saw it once.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Vile excuse for a conservation centre. Turtles are kept stacked on top of each other in a tiny, filthy tank and tourists are encouraged to manhandle them to take photos for their insta. Absolutely disgusting and sickening conditions - please do not support this behavior.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: When I first got to the beach they give you a price list with a ridiculous price and keep negotiating but still a rip off! The glass bottom boat wasn’t clear with only 2 piece of bread to bring fish. Once on turtle island you will find the big turtles in a shallow area with dirty water. Then a few smaller ones in a small pond like area. 1 iguana 2 toucans, 1 bat and 2 snakes that all looked depressed. Then ask for $15 for a picture and a donation to feed animals. Wish I read these reviews before I booked.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Don’t. We read “turtle rehab and recovery center,” and believed it. This was one of the pricier things we did and it is a sad tourist trap of poor caged animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Pure Abzocke! Tiere sind eingesperrt und dienen nur als Fotomotive. Die Fotos sind dazu auch noch von schlechter Qualität.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not go here! It’s a turtle petting zoo, was under the impression as called ‘turtle island with smorkling’ that we would be seeing the turtles in their natural habitat in the sea. So wrong, they have tiny pools with about 10 turtles in each one! Also bird which are clearly in distress and plucking feathers and snakes which have no space at all. Also was charged a lot of money to be scammed, very disappointing trip.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We hired a driver for the day to see that side of Bali and he took us to the water sports and "Turtle Island" spot... they charged us 2.5mil rupee, so around 250nzd and I thought we were going to an island where turtles were free and used this island as their home. Boy, I was wrong and felt sick knowing that I had contributed to that kind of treatment of animals. The animals stay in small cages with no type of natural habitat or stimulation. They looked sad and it was sad to see animals in this state. I think that had I known what turtle island actually was, I would never had gone. I will never let my driver choose the tour destinations again. Please don't go...

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Avoid this by all means! 
 
 First of all this is a rip-off.
