 Second of all animals in the zoo are not well taken care of. 
 
 Just don’t go there!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We didn't have any idea how bad this could be for the animals there. They looked distressed and it's obvious that they don't care about animal welfare. The business claimed to be ECO Tourism and its rehabilitation program is not backed up by any mean. That's truly insulting. All they do is encourage you to touch the animals. Please don't come here to just to pet wild animals, this type of farm should not exist anymore.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Terrible. Poor animals, seem to be abused in a very sad way. Do not go there. Let’s support the respect to wild life. Sad and hope the authorities do something about it soon

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Unfortunately we haven't done enough research before visiting this place. I wouldn't ever visit again ❗
 Turtle island is a big cruetly for the animals living there;
 Many turtles in small and stinky water basins,
 snakes with tape around their heads,
 & lots of animals in small and dirty cages!
 
 We paid a lot of money - they told us, they use it for the health of the 'sick' animals - but it totally doesn't look like that.
 
 Please don't support this place & stay away!
 and also save your money. First they wanted 90$ for one Person, we got it down to 30$ that was still way to much for this crap. I would rather burn my Money than give it to these bad people again.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: They wanted to charge 100 USD per person, we negotiated it down to 12 USD per person. Yet it was a ripoff. Poor conditions for the animals. Dirty. Better not waste your time. Place should be shut down.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I am writing as a tourist that had visited Bali earlier this month in November. Our family's visit to the supposed Turtle Island was marred by the sight and experience that was had nothing to do with conservation. It was a walkabout with turtles and other animals in captivity, not the turtles you see being rehabilitated and hatchlings being released back into the wild. 
 
 This tourist destination at Tanjung Benoa is an abomination to the true work that wildlife conservationist have put in to protect wildlife of Indonesia. Further, it was a scam to ROB tourists that want to see good work put in to protect the wildlife of Indonesia. 
 
 The guide on the island even asked us for an under table donation after the tour. This is most deplorable!
 
 Like what others have said: STAY AWAY AT ALL COSTS!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Our visit to this place was sudden and unplanned but, the experience was amazing. If I had read the reviews of this place before I visited, I wouldn’t have visited this place at all. This place takes care not only of sea turtles but also a few bird, a snake and when we visited a baby monkey as well. This place has a few sea turtles that they take care of always and a few others that they were just tending to when hurt (once healed they let the turtle back into the sea). The other animals in this place seemed comfy and friendly with the staff. The iguana and snake were out in the open and roaming around freely, they didn’t move away or even try to attack us when we moved close to them. The island even had a rare albino sea turtle there as well. The overall experience was really good, the staff is doing a great job trying to take care of the animals and reptiles here. I strongly suggest people to visit this place at least once.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I think the turtle should have it better in there pools, especially the one with just dirty pool water in. Interesting for my toddler but they should really improve the turtles and animals cages and pools. The boat trip over was fun for my kid

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
ABSOLUTELY DISGUSTING. DO NOT COME HERE. 
 My partner and I didn’t do any research on this place before we agreed with our driver that we’d do it because it was organised the day before we went and trusted our drivers opinion on it. 
 
 The boat trip there was horrible, the glass bottom boat isn’t even good, the water is absolutely filthy and you you can’t see anything. 
 
 Upon arriving we thought we’d see turtles on the beach and in the water but didn’t see anything, as we walked into the place we were absolutely horrified. I wanted to cry. ITS PURE ANIMAL CRUELTY in this place. The owner was following us around like a bad smell trying to justify the living conditions these animals were living in. It was absolutely filth, we didn’t spend long here we left very quickly. 
 
 The turtles were swimming in the filthiest water and in the smallest spaces, then along with the animals that are tied up in chains. There was a baby monkey there that was chained around the neck and could hardly move around far, the monkey was crying. After this I left, absolutely horrified at this disgraceful place.
 I have no idea how this business is still running

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This is one of the worst places I have seen. They call it eco tourism and keep the animals caged. Turtles are kept in tanks.. I wonder why these are not let back to the ocean. There is nothing positive about the place... you get an eerie feeling seeing the bat and the big black bird ( it looked a wood pecker to me)
 
 If they want to run this place, they should call it a mini zoo or something and not eco tourism. Terrible experience.
 
 I wish atleast we had a good boat ride, which isnt there. It takes about 20 minutes and the whole ride is near the shore itself. Glass bottom boat is a scam, you cant see anything through the glass. The only positive was the boatman who was polite and well mannered like most of the people in Bali are.
 
 Very disappointing.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This was so incredibly depressing. I wish we had done our due diligence prior to visiting this place. We were sold this as part of a tour, like many others. And we too thought this was a place that was naturally inhabited by turtles. We had turtle eggs be laid on our resort beach and I guess ignorantly thought the turtles lived on this turtle island place. The glass bottom boat, like others have said was very disappointing. Our glass was cracked and leaking. The snorkelling portion was absolutely foul. The water was full of rubbish and we were just expected to jump in amongst the dirt, debris and floating sneaker. But the turtle island was abhorrent. The sign out the front reads ‘eco tourism’, this was ironic as when we arrived the staff were sweeping mounds of rubbish including plastic bottles back into the ocean which must have accumulated over night. All the animals look miserable and felt so wrong to be there. My heart aches for those poor turtles. Strongly recommend avoiding this all together!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Awful experience, we unfortunately ended up here due to a mis communication with our driver as we wanted to go to the Turtle conservation and education centre we were confused as to why we had to get a boat there (at a ridiculous cost) as it was on the mainland. Everything just got worse from there. This place should be closed down the treatment of the animals here is disgraceful we felt trapped there and just wanted to get out of there. When we asked to leave we just got pressured to buy things and give the people there tips as they don’t get paid. Please, please don’t go here! We did finally make it to the turtle conservation and education centre, no boat required and it’s completely free and it was a magical experience. Please be very clear with your driver and don’t end up here!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT, go to Turtle Island. First, the glass bottomed boat features glass about 4 ft by 1 ft. There is no way you can see fish as you’re speeding by on the boat. And the glass is streaked and dirty. On the island, there were 8 or 9 turtles in several shallow white-tiled tubs…they looked miserable. I was expecting lots of turtles roaming around the sandy beaches…none was to be seen. There was 1 bat, 1 python, 1 monitor lizard…I can’t bother anymore. It cost a whopping 350,000 IDR to get there, and we spent barely 15 minutes. And it’s not even an island! A bottle of coke cost 5x more. IT WAS DISAPPOINTING! Please believe me.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
One doesn't need to be an Einstein to realise that when confronted by a roadside seller of all things good (full day tours with your own private car and driver to go wherever you want, for just $50 AUD) that something a little dodgy is going on.
 
 This we know, however the collusion factor in Bali is simply off the Richter scale!
 
 So, after paying a deposit of 200,000 rupiah and being advised to pay the driver directly the remaining 300,000, the day comes and sure enough the driver arrives on time and with a smile as wide and high as Niagara Falls. He's a lovely fella who claims he will do whatever we want, take us wherever we prefer, he will work as late into the night as we want - all for a measly 300,000 rupiah. 
 
 Being shmucks in not having bothered to check any reviews, we suggest; "it's up to you, take us wherever you think is good!" Off we trot through Seminyak's ridiculously crowded narrow roads kicking off the list of 'things to do' with a visit to the Sahadewa Barong & Kris Dance (see review elsewhere), we also visited another 2 so-called attractions before making our way to what is commonly referred to as Turtle Island.
 
 Exact scenario: On arrival the driver speaks to a salesman who sits us down to discuss the options. We asked to check out what was supposed to be an amazing turtle site. The cost – in AUD - $60 per head. But hey, we had our own boat and driver to take us to the island: - trust me, it’s not an island having a road that takes you to the front door! But nobody wants to tell you this! You’re also told it takes only 15 minutes followed by a walk on the beach. Wow. The glass bottomed boat ride was only just ok due to a low tide making it near impossible to get to the turtle facility, likewise the water itself was hopelessly polluted. 
 
 We stop some 150 metres out from the facility where we must get out and negotiate water, coral and muddy sand. It’s ok for me, however the wife struggled, so much so that the boat driver had to carry her on his back!
 
 We finally make it to the somewhat dishevelled facility to see very poorly maintained and shoddy surroundings, a few turtles (maybe 30 or so) along with a small number of birdlife, a couple of bats etc. The tour guide (we were only there for around 20 minutes) was a great guy, but he, like all involved in these scams, are well versed in what to do. Bottom line; as much as it appears that the plight of this outfit saving turtles is admirable, I don’t think it’s the full story.
 
 Would I recommend this place? Not on your life. Spend much less money on something reputable!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Pengalaman yang sangat baik. Sayangnya, kandang untuk penyu cukup kecil karena keterbatasan dana. Stafnya sangat ramah dan penuh perhatian. Ada juga kesempatan untuk melihat hewan lain selain penyu dan menyentuhnya. Kami bahkan bisa melepaskan seekor bayi penyu kembali ke laut.
 Kami tidak membayar sesuai harga yang tertera di Tripadvisor.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Don’t go to turtle island, it is a massive rip off and is horribly cruel to turtles! we went thinking we would see wild turtles swimming around the island in their natural habitat however we were appalled to see large sea turtles trapped in small dirty bath like tanks missing parts of their shells with no space to swim. They had buckets of baby turtles and tried to make us pay to release them into the middle of the sea where they would probably drown! There were also lots of other birds and bats trapped in tiny enclosures, do not recommend

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Thought I was going to an island inhabited by wild turtles - arrived at a concrete area where huge turtles were kept in what were practically kiddy paddling pools with unclean water and no space for them to move, let alone swim. it was clear the turtles were very depressed and suffering. other animals such as birds were also kept chained up in tiny enclosures. Furthermore, this ‘experience’ wasn’t even cheap in the slightest
 
 Do not reccommend the snorkelling either, spent a fair amount of money just to peer into cloudy water at a few rocks…

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: I was conned into going by the water sports people at Nusa Dua. Charged lots of money to see poorly treated animals. Should be shut down, Bali should be ashamed

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Wir halten diesen Ort für Tierquälerei und Touristen-Abzocke (wie sehr viele andere ebenso hier schreiben). Die meisten Tiere sind angekettet und werden für Geldmacherei und Foto-Zwecke ausgebeutet. Geht lieber zum TURTLE SANCTUATY AND EDUCATION CENTRE. dort werden die Tiere liebevoll versorgt (ebenfalls kleine Becken, aber die Mitarbeiter kümmern sich gut und lassen Baby Schildkröten ins Meer zurück. Geht lieber dort hin, wenn euch Tiere am Wohl liegen und ihr ohne schlechtes Gewissen Wasserschildkröten sehen wollt :) )

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Mengerikan… penyu-penyu malang dimasukkan ke kolam atau genangan air yang sempit dan berdesakan. Wisata ini tidak menawarkan apa pun selain melihat bagaimana penyu-penyu tersebut menderita.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: An animal lover’s worst nightmare!!! I was crying as soon as I stepped foot on this “island”. This was the worst thing I have ever experienced! I have no doubt in my mind that these animals are kept there until they die. It’s the saddest thing I have ever seen. Tourist trap! Was sold a “swim with sea torture” experience and was shipped onto this “island”. The pools are tiny and filled with murky water. Toucans in small cages, clearly underweight and neglected,… the list goes on. Please don’t go!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This experience was honestly heartbreaking and not at all the exciting and wholesome experience we were told it would be. The small, shallow pools that multiple turtles are kept in for long periods of time are concerning! tourists take photos in the pool amongst the turtles, without being instructed on how to go about it without harming them. 
 There are also wild reptiles (a python and iguana) left unsupervised on the floor in the middle of the “sanctuary” for uneducated tourists to pose next to! Many other animals, clearly depressed and neglected are kept in extremely small cages with no enrichment or fresh water. An un-tamed parrot is tied to a short chain, distressed. 
 This visit was heartbreaking and is a big no no for any animal lovers out there.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is a tourist trap, masquerading as a conservation park, while exploiting animals for photos. Animals subjected to poor handling and conditions. Do not go!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Turtle island has been the same for 10 years. Animals and turtles look great. Staff were as awesome as ever and I would go back again. They do there very best with the small funds they have available. Thankyou turtle island for another wonderful visit.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Wish I could choose less than 1 star
 We got made to believe it was a conservation type place ,boy we were wrong 
 We arrived and just saw concrete baths with overpopulated turtles 
 Some turtles being 80 years old just trapped and won't be released they honestly have no intention on releasing turtles. We got rushed through so fast it was the worst experience ever 
 Do not waste your money

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Do not go! ANIMAL CRUELTY This is not a conservation center like they seem to keep rambling on about, the turtles have only inches of water in some places and are kept for purposes only of tourism and to take your money! We thought they would be in the ocean but found them trapped in a small murky pool of water! The guide seem to mention from his first sentence that he was only a volunteer and they dont get money etc (to prompt us to tip him).. At the end they basically shoved a photo of us in our face making us feel obliged to buy PLUS asking to tip the guide! this was not an enjoyable experience and many other people said the same!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is a terrible place to go. Magnificent turtles 15 yrs old kept in tiny shallow pools. They say they rehabilitate. I'm not sure, these turtles look healthy and could easily live in the sea. Very cruel and I feel terrible I went and supported it thinking I was doing the right thing. Please do not go.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Don't bother! We booked for Turtle Island, which is apparently a rescue centre for injured turtles - This it is not! It's a very poor, tacky, and run down tourist attraction.
 
 This place should be closed down, turtles in grotty glass tanks and pools, with not enough space, so they try to escape, fed only on seaweed. The murky tanks only have dregs of seaweed for food, and are not even an attempt to make it look, or feel to them like their natural habitat. There is a small what I can only describe as a child's sandpit where they breed the baby turtles, that are unlikely to ever be released to the wild.
 There are various size turtles, in various tanks, in very dirty and overcrowded conditions. Next up comes the tacky zoo at the back, with a random owl, a snake, a lizard, a bat, and a monkey. All in very small cages, and the baby monkey looks absolutely terrified.
 
 Then they hit you up with a photo you never asked for at 120'000 that you feel compelled to purchase, then stitch you up with drinks that cost double anywhere else. In effect, you're held to ransom
 
 We went here at the recommendation of our driver, apparently it's usually 1 million IDR for a couple, but we got it a lot less. It could have been free and I would still be disgusted.
 
 I would advise everyone boycott this place, till they get some animal welfare issues sorted out

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: There were many turtles in the collection, some of which were very large. There was a guide there that explained all the animals.In addition to the turtle, there were several species of birds and other animals, such as the luwak in the cage . I did not like this place

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Awful. Shockingly bad environment for a range of poor animals.
 
 Turtles are kept in shallow concrete pools with literally nothing but a tiny bit of sand in the bottom. Not a stone or piece of seaweed. 
 
 Water looked quite deoxygenated. These are marine animals that dive deep, they are not meant to be kept in 30cm of warm water with no stimulation at all. 
 
 A range of birds in empty wire mesh cages. An eagle with nothing in cage except a tree branch, that’s it, nothing else. 
 
 Bats didn’t even have the luxury of a branch. Fruit bats hanging from the mesh at top of their cage. Apart from one that was jammed into a rabbit hutch.
 
 Who locks a peacock in a cage? They hang around if fed and treated well. A row of sad birds in small cages with nothing else in them.
 
 I was disgusted and fuming!
 
 Bali zoo, bird park and safari are great - great examples of how to house animals in appropriate and stimulating environments. 
 
 This place should be shut down and the owners locked in small empty cages - see how they like it.
 
 Please, please, please for the sake of these and future animals do not go. Do not give them any profit from treating animals this way.
 
 Absolutely disgusting.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: El lugar da mucho miedo. Los animales están en muy malas condiciones. Los tienen para fotografías con turista y no lo tienen cuidados. Metidos en jaulas y espacios super pequeños. Fuera de su hábitat. Es el sitio de bali q menos me ha gustado . Salimos horrorizados.... pecamos de turista , porq no conociamos esto.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: A visit to Turtle Island was included in a tour we booked. We were told it was a conservation site for turtles however we would disagree. The turtles are kept in exceptionally small 'pools' about the size of a square bath. They then show you the other animals they have caged or chained which include; bats, and owl, an iguana, toucans, and others I cannot recall. No information on HOW they rehabilitate them to be released, and all are available to take photos with which would imply they are being abused for profit. Very disappointed to have supported this place.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
DO NOT SUPPORT THIS!! Glass bottom boat n snorkel were fabbo but this place!!!!! 
 I’m sorry I supported this horrendous place. 30 turtles crammed into a tiny space.. birds, bats, n snakes in terrible conditions..... I’m sorry turtles I really am

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Good place, if what we were informed, regards looking after and healing damaged turtles, for release to the wild again, when ready. Several other animals kept in cages also, they could be doing with some extra funds to improve the area.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is not worth visiting and is expensive. The tour guides are on commission and encourage you to visit. Not a pleasant experience despite the boat price reduced by 50% post negotiations. They mention glass bottom boat, marine life view, coral , but this is non existence apart from a few fish. Not really an Island and the turtles are caged. Very misleading

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: My husband and I visited Turtle Island yesterday and were pleasantly surprised. We got there by glass bottomed boat through which we saw lots of beautiful fish. The turtles that had been rescued were in clean water although could have done with being in bigger pools. We got the impression they were cared for unlike some people who have done reviews. One person said the python had its mouth taped. This was not the case yesterday and I cannot think why it would have been as pythons do not bite.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
People please don’t visit this place. These poor animals are not looked after. The python snakes has the head taped up . It’s filthy and it’s expensive for what u get.$57Aud pp. you get a bottomless boat ride but on a cloudy day you can see very little. Those turtles look filthy 
 Don’t recommend you go

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This place is not doing any animal conservation. The poor turtles are in ankle deep filthy water, not enough room for them to swim. They encourage you to touch them for photos. They look so sad and desperate to be free. Then there are the tiny cages for the other animals - monkeys, birds, lizards and a snake with it's mouth taped shut. I actually walked out before we got to that section in tears after seeing the poor beautiful turtles in their hellish enclosures. This place needs to be shut down. The price is a con too, $100aud for snorkelling in filthy water that I refused to do, and a trip in the glass bottom boat to the island which is not an island at all. It's all a huge scam. I hope it gets closed down.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We left Turtle Island extremely upset at the poor living conditions these poor animals are living in. Firstly we were charged $118.00 AUD for a one hour tour run through BMR Dive and Watersports. A total rip-off. The brochure shows that the turtles are in the ocean when you visit them. Complete bulldust, this is far from the truth, these beautiful turtles are living in a dirty pond of minimal water. The other animals, birds, goannas are all living in small cages, the snakes looked seriously sick and the mongoose's living conditions brought tears to my eyes, it was in a tiny rusted cage without even a floor in the cage, this poor animal was also not well. To top it off, the cheek of the guide, he tried to say that he was a volunteer and would like a tip. Please please do not support or go to this horrific tourist attraction. It should be shut down immediately.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
We went on a boat trip to Turtle island under the impression of going to a turtle conservation zoo.
 At first it seemed exciting to be able to go into the water with these majestic giant turtles, our guide started out with lots of informative information and good fun distracting banter, I struck up a happy positive conversation to delve deeper into what is really going on here,as my thoughts kept thinking of possible buy, keep ,sell,I don’t know however judge for yourself if you go and ask lots of questions.
 The guide did reveal that the turtles are bought off local fishermen for a sum of money 
 The most disturbing thing is the bird who was terrified of the keeper, very stressed, when approached the bird was squawking, hissing and bristling its neck feathers, the bird would obediently jump on to the visitors arm when the keeper approached, running off terrified after, when I mentioned its stress the guide said “ he likes it “ or they love massage, it was encouraged to hold and pat each animal.
  There was a very big group of kids and families, kids chasing the birds anything goes here, appalling !!!! , I felt very sad after visiting.
 Needs urgent action 
 Worst of all the people are so friendly and lovely making a living as best they can, completely unaware of what is ethical or of basic animal care they just can’t comprehend how to care for the animals if only somebody could show the way here.
 Why are the monkeys there and not at the monkey park orphanage? We where told they where hurt and will be released in two years

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We bargaind down to $80 US and what a frigging rip off. Boat was dirty, the operator stopped over some fish and just about gased us all, we told him to keep moving. The water was full of trash on the 10 minute boat ride to the most horrendous cages and dirty pools of water to supposedly see animals in a conservation area on the inlet not an Island. Then you pay for a someone to take you through the cesspool and to use their gross bathrooms.Don't fool yourself every guide gets a cut of where they take you that charges admission and thats how we ended up there to get a ride on the boat with his friend. Do not let them take you to places to eat that they pick, choose your own and have them stop there. If people stop going then maybe those animals can be set free.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Only gave it a 1 because I had too. Please do not visit this place and continue the suffering of these poor animals. Concrete pens with inches of water so you can get in and pet these majestic creatures. Other animals kept in inhumane conditions. We will be reporting this place to international authorities for urgent action.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: This is an amazing place and you enjoy the ride in the boat. You feel you are with thr turtles. The guides are very helpful.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
The visit to Turtle island was awful.it is claimed that it is for turtle conservation. It is like a zoo out of the dark ages.animals kept in concrete enclosures with no vegetation. The big poor sea turtles have not enough water to swim and are crowded into a small space. 
 There are other animals like snakes and they have their mouths taped together so they can't bite. Owls sitting on a perch without a tree.
 The whole place is horrible and a money making scam .I hope they do have eggs in the sand and release hatchlings but there is a better way without being cruel to the animals.
 The business should be banned! Until they take care of the animals.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Das Ganze wird als Auffangstation und Hilfsprojekt für Meeresschildkröten getarnt. Tatsächlich ist es eine Art Zoo, wo die Tiere unter katastrophalen Umständen gehalten werden
 Den Schlangen wurde mit Klebeband Augen und Maul aufgeklebt und die anderen Tiere in kleinen verdreckten Käfigen gehalten. 
 Ich rate dringend von einem Besuch ab.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Not that nice but we enjoy it.. it is not clean and messy.. i hope they clean it and utilize the place in better way

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
I failed to do my "homework" before going. We were running out of places to go to, and our guide-cum-driver spontaneously suggested this place, saying the kids would like it. We agreed, without any idea what it was all about.
 
 We got to the jetty where we had to haggle with the boat operator to get us to the island. This was when it should have set alarm bells ringing, but I failed to pay heed because they did a good job getting the children excited about seeing animals etc as a distraction. 
 
 The operator first quoted some price that was plain insane, to probably test our "appetite", observing our facial expressions carefully. When he noticed we were not impressed, he quickly add "but... because we are all Asians, I give you big discount" and offered a less ridiculous, but still ridiculous, price.
 
 I was about to walk away when he offered another "best price", and this to-and-fro on the endlessly adjustable "final best price" just went on for several rounds before it got to a point when at I was just tired of the process, and when I knew at least I would not be feeling silly and kicking myself, and agreed, just to get on with our day.
 
 We had a boat to ourselves (my family and our guide). The boatman must have been the most accomplished sailor ever, being able to steer a boat with his foot and save his hands for cigarettes. He brought us somewhere five minutes out where he handed out some bread to the kids to throw in the water, to attract fish which we could see from the small glass panel at the bottom of the boat.
 
 After getting rid of the bread, we continued on the ride to the island, about 10 minutes away. Upon approaching, we saw the signs which informed us we were approaching a "sanctuary", and the boatman added that the amount we paid for the boat ride actually included a "donation" to the "sanctuary" on our behalf. Sounded like we were doing something nice for the animals at this point.
 
 We were assigned a "guide" at the entrance who would bring us around the place. To his credit, he was friendly and tried his best to keep the children happy. However, his individual efforts could not get us to ignore the signs that "sanctuary" was quite likely a misrepresentation.
 
 The guide claimed that many of the animals were rescued and brought to the island for conservation. To give them the benefit of the doubt, since there was no way of verifying the animals' histories, it was possible to take their word for it that the animals were indeed rescued from somewhere. However it did feel like they were brought to the "sanctuary" for exploitation rather than conservation. 
 
 There were no rules of engagement for the tourists, and we were even encouraged to pick up the animals (ignoring the animals' and our discomfort) for picture-taking. In some instances, the island guide literally shoved the animals at us, telling us not to be shy, and even suggested silly poses with the creatures for the camera.
 
 My children (2 and 5 yo) do like animals in general, and did enjoy themselves on the visit, thinking it was a treat to be allowed to interact with the animals up close, and being to young to be able to fully comprehend the ethical issues. However, the adults did not feel too comfortable on the visit. Guess we learned our lesson, to do some research and read some reviews before visiting the next "sanctuary".

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Don‘t visit this “sanctuary”. It is a living hell for the animals. Look at the pictures and see for yourself!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: It’s a relatively small place with a lot of turtles and also other kinds of animals. You can do a quick trip while doing other water sports activities at the tanjung benoa beach. It’s about 5 minute boat ride to this place from the main water sports center.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Did this as part of a snorkeling trip, it is horrible very cruel the poor turtle are kept in only a little water and the snakes have there mouth tapped together, please don't support this

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: ヌサドゥアのグランドミラージュホテルのビーチからグラスボートに乗ったら、途中で休憩地としてここに到達。最初は何か怪しい物でも売り付けられるのか？と身構えてしまうような見栄えの施設でしたが、従業員さん達はみんな優しくてサービス精神旺盛。ウミガメへの餌やり体験や、ニシキヘビ、イグアナ、ペリカン？との触れ合いなど、小さい場所ながら濃い時間が過ごせました。入場料はひと家族60万ルピアなので500円くらい？あと動物保護への支援、ということで動物との触れ合い写真を買うと150万ルピア(約1200円)かかりましたが、この施設を応援したくなって喜んで払いました。とにかくチャンスがあれば是非子連れで訪れてください。

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Despite having read poor reviews we decided to take a boat trip here to decide for ourselves. From the first seconds of arriving you are under no illusion at what a hellhole this is for the animals. Loads of Adult turtles in a concrete pool, families wandering amongst them, touching , and generally filling the pool with bacteria. Even witnessed a young lad laying in the water to the hilarity of the staff. The turtles are treated so poorly its unbelievable. One adult Turtle was in a pool alone in about an inch of water, I asked what the deal was with the animal, the lady said it had been unwell for 3 months and was recovering. I then asked the man who appeared to be running the show and he told me that it was sleeping. Upon challenging what he said he then barked at his staff member for telling me it was unwell. This particular character walks about the place shouting at visitors to pick up the various animals including a massive lizard,Snakes, various chained birds and even encouraged people to go into a bats cage, which suspiciously hung from one leg,for photos while it supposedly slept. I have never seen anything like it in my life. Please do not go there, it is barbaric. I do not claim to be the worlds most dedicated animal lover but what I saw has left me with sadness and total disbelief. The squalor, poor treatment and disregard for the animals here speak for itself. Avoid this place if offered a trip.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: We visit turtle island while staying with Grand Mirage it was great, my boys loved seeing all the animals, our tour guide was very happy and informative, shame a monsoon came while visiting we just had to wait it out

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: The guide that met me was lovely but then proceeded to very quickly move me through the various animal enclosures. My driver had said that you were able to hold a turtle but the guide gave me 2 fake turtles to hold. For a turtle rehab facility, it was extremely small and disappointing. At the end of the 5min tour, the guide asked me for a tip, not impressed. This was a waste of my time and money.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: DONT GO! Its hell on eart.. poor animals, i start to cry.. its the most horror place i ever see in my life.. please do not support this curel.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text: Animal cruelty at its finest, snakes with tapes mouths, all animals in very small enclosures. Was told it was a sancuary it deffinatly is not .. please don't make the same mistake we did by going here and accidentally supporting this.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
This island was part of the package we booked.
 The speed boat was nice and clean but the island itself was a bit disappointing.
 They have sections for huge turtles, baby tutels and a big lizard and birds.
 So many locals are trying to sell their products in a very expensive price compared to other places (do not buy anything from there).

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
0 stars if I could. We were first told it was turtle island, and then that it was turtle beach, so we expected to see turtles in the wild and be able to swim with them and see them on the beach. When we got there it said Turtle Farm, and it was absolute disgust. They capture these animals and tell you they rehabilitate them and release them into the wild, and there is 0 proof of it, and they have 50-70 year old turtles swimming into walls trying to get out. Absolutely terrible conditions, they had over 50 turtles in a puddle crammed in. Don’t get me started on the other animals they had caged in with terrible conditions. 
 
 DONT SUPPORT THIS TREATMENT OF ANIMALS!!!

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Animal Cruelty at its finest.
 Filthy conditions. Concrete jungle for turtles that have no space to move. Tourists sitting on turtles for photos. Animals mouths are taped together.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Zero stars if I could. The hotel we were staying at had excursions available and the one we chose, myself reluctantly, was a “turtle sanctuary”. We got to the start point where we boat out of. The sales guy is telling us all the price is 80 a person. We ask why exactly and his English get really bad all of a sudden. I told him the 80 dollar package included snorkeling and we didn’t want to snorkel. We only wanted the $50 package that includes the glass boat in crap water and a trip to “turtle island” which actually isn’t an island by the way. He tried to charge us 70 a person anyway and when he realized we only wanted what the hotel had quoted us in print he gave in. We get there and as soon as we get off we meet our “tour guide”. They immediately ask where you are from so they can gauge their prospects on getting money out of you. My only satisfaction here was that after telling them we were from California I am hopeful they were really let down after not leaving them one cent. I don’t want any tour guide I want to explore myself but there was nothing to explore anyway. Beautiful sea turtles in shallow concrete tanks, then they show us their other animals. A couple of crappy toucans, a snake and finally f’ng turkeys. I flew 20 hours to see turkeys? They ask if we wanted pictures with the animals to which I replied “Not at all”. We didn’t give them a dime. They make us take a picture in front of a turtle statue and try to sell it to you. No thanks. Beverages?? As much as I wanted a beer to take a little sour out of the experience, hell no again. No to any “contribution” or money in any of their pocket. 
 Do not ever go. The biggest waste of an excursion you can ever have trust me.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Hari yang sangat menyenangkan dengan perjalanan perahu dan kunjungan ke Turtle Island.
 Mereka melakukan banyak upaya untuk menyelamatkan penyu. Kami juga diperbolehkan memberi makan penyu-penyu tersebut.
 Selain itu, ada juga hewan mamalia dan burung lain yang boleh diberi makan.
 Kami memesan seorang sopir bernama Wayan yang bekerja sama dengan Get Your Guide. Kami menyewanya secara pribadi untuk satu hari penuh dengan biaya sekitar 300 SEK.

location_name: Dari DELUANG SARI Penangkaran Penyu Bali Tanjung Benoa
review_text:
Unfortunately we wanted our driver to take us to the turtle conservation and education centre which has great reviews on TA. He drove us to the port in Benoa / Nusa Dua and we got sold to by the boat people to take speed boat to the alleged above turtle conservation Centre. Ended up paying 700,000 rupees for 4 of us for speedboat. Massively ripped off. 
 Get there and realise this is turtle island not the conservation centre. ☹️ no baby turtles no opportunity to release into ocean. Just a poorly run zoo with poorly treated animals and reptiles. 
 Beach was dirty full of rubbish, plastic and overrun with boats and Chinese tourists. 
 Very pushy volunteers who expect you to donate and buy souvenirs ☹️
Always 'funtastic' for nature and health lovers

Taman Nasional Bali Barat, dapat ditempuh dengan menaiki kapal. Terdapat banyak hewan Rusa atau Kijang yang berkeliaran di pulau tersebut. Waktu itu cuaca cukup cerah jadi bisa menikmati keindahan alam disini.

user_name: 目黒さんの横にいる人
review_text:
Pulau ini sangat indah. Total biaya memang sangat mahal, tetapi saya tetap memutuskan untuk datang ke sini. Sayangnya, ada cukup banyak sampah, itu benar-benar disayangkan. Saya juga berharap ada perahu gabungan untuk wisatawan solo karena harga feri sangat tinggi.
 Pemandu saya sangat ramah dan bertanggung jawab; ia selalu memperhatikan saya dan mengambilkan banyak foto yang bagus. Secara keseluruhan pulau ini sangat indah, air lautnya jernih luar biasa, dengan ikan-ikan kecil yang berenang tepat di tepi pantai serta rusa-rusa yang jinak. Anda bahkan bisa menyentuhnya dengan bebas.

Mohon utk pelayanan tiket tidak ribet, sy bawa tamu asing di portal 1 kena 50K di portal 2 bayar 300K & dipaksa menggunakan guide disitu,yg mana tamu tdk mau pake jasa guide karena sdh brsma sy selaku guide. Akhirnya sepakat dgn petugas disitu hanya utk lihat pantai & konservasi burung jalak.

Stunning and underrated place, but a guide is necessary to unlock its beauty. Please be careful who you select as your guide as many can be hit or miss. Would highly recommend Idris (search Idris West Bali National Park on Google for contact info) for bird lovers, he is an expert at identifying birds from sound and then finding them for you to look at.
 
 On our tour we positively identified over 40 species of birds including the critically endangered Bali Myna and endangered Black Winged Myna. We also saw multiple black giant squirrels, countless monkeys (black lutung and long tail macaques), and deer.
 
 My only complaint about this park is the garbage that can be found on the west beaches. This park really needs an initiative by the Indonesian government to clean up this park as it's so stunning.

Pemandu hanya berkendara di depan kami dengan motor dengan kecepatan sekitar 30 km/jam, lalu malah menegur kami karena dianggap berkendara terlalu cepat.
 Dari segi satwa, kami hanya melihat monyet, beberapa ayam yang sebenarnya setiap hari saya lihat di jalan, dan sepasang rusa yang terlihat kurus dan tidak terawat. Tidak jelas untuk apa uang sebanyak itu diminta—setidaknya taman ini seharusnya dirawat dengan layak.

The West Bali National Park is a hidden gem located in the western part of Bali. The park boasts of stunning natural landscapes that are sure to take your breath away. The park is home to a wide variety of flora and fauna, including endangered species like the Bali starling and Javan rusa. Visitors can enjoy activities such as hiking, bird watching, and snorkeling in the pristine waters surrounding the park. The park is also home to several historical sites, including the Pura Giri Kencana temple, which offers a glimpse into Bali's rich cultural heritage.
 
 The West Bali National Park is the perfect place to escape from the hustle and bustle of city life. The park is a haven of peace and tranquility where visitors can relax and rejuvenate amidst nature. The park offers several accommodation options, ranging from basic camping sites to luxurious villas, ensuring that visitors can find a stay that suits their budget and preferences. The park is also home to several restaurants and cafes that serve delicious local cuisine, providing visitors with a taste of Bali's unique culinary culture.
 
 In conclusion, the West Bali National Park is a must-visit destination for nature lovers and adventure enthusiasts. The park offers a unique experience that combines natural beauty, cultural heritage, and adventure activities. Visitors can explore the park at their own pace and indulge in activities that suit their interests. Whether you're looking for a peaceful retreat or an adrenaline-filled adventure, the West Bali National Park has something for everyone. So pack your bags and head to this hidden gem in Bali for an unforgettable experience.

0 stars, worst experience in 1 year in Bali. They have 1 official government price 200-300k rp per person, even kids posted on entrance (which is already x20 for foreigners vs local people, I can understand x2-3, but not x20...) and even this price is not enough to satisfy the appetite, stuff at entrance don't allow to enter the park on your own car and tickets until you pay and buy on-top additionally from their extra-menu tours or guide service. This is a gold mine for them probably... unpleasant conversations and situations. Especially on the contrast of such nice experiences elsewhere in Bali, that I had for the last year living here.

Avoid this place…!!! Bullies and local mafia trying to rip you off. I understand that the price for tourist is more but then locals will bully you into getting a ‘’tour’’ for a ridiculous amount. Hanya ada satu pintu masuk ke taman.
 Cukup mengejutkan untuk Bali, tetapi di sini benar-benar kacau. Tiket resmi seharusnya 200, namun di pintu masuk ada sekelompok orang yang tidak mengizinkan masuk tanpa ikut “tur” seharga 1 juta. Hal ini sudah banyak ditulis di ulasan, tetapi mereka tidak peduli.
 Selain itu, sebenarnya tidak ada “tur” jeep seperti yang dijanjikan—yang ada hanya seorang pemandu yang ikut bersama Anda.
 Kami akhirnya berbalik dan pergi. Awalnya kami nekat melanjutkan perjalanan begitu saja, mereka tidak mengejar, tetapi kemudian meminta kami berhenti dan kami menunggu mereka.
 Kesimpulan: atau bersiap membayar secara tidak resmi ke kantong seseorang, atau masuk dengan cara nekat.

Kami sudah sampai ke taman dari Pemuteran, tetapi akhirnya tidak bisa masuk. Entah kenapa kami tidak diizinkan masuk dengan skuter, dan malah ditawari paket tur yang sangat mahal, mulai dari 1.100.000 rupiah. Mereka mengatakan tidak boleh masuk sendiri. Kami akhirnya pergi begitu saja karena tidak ada pilihan lain, tetapi kami tidak siap membayar uang sebanyak itu.

Pemandangan Indah Di Setiap Sudut

Located in the North West of Bali island, in two regency of Buleleng area +Jembrana area. It's nature conservation area which has the original ecosystem, working to protect a wide variety of wild flora and fauna. Covering the sea, beach and the mainland coast, lowland forests, and mountains, as well as coral reef, coastal waters and small offshore island called Menjangan. The latter is a very popular diving destination and shows high bio-diversity in a relatively small marine area. At the end of the last century, 110 species of corals belonging to 18 families were recorded, of which 22 species were of the mushroom coral family (there are only 29 species of mushroom corals recorded worldwide), and there were at least 27 species of Acropora coral found in a relatively small area of only 2 hectares.Unspoilt beauty lies at the west end of the fabled island of Bali: lush green forests, picturesque mountain range, crystal clear blue water, and vast stretches of pristine beaches, those are what await at the West Bali National Park.
 
 Home to over a hundred species of wildlife. You can see more than 200 species of plants as well as black monkeys, leaf monkeys, macaques and mouse deer. The national park is best known as the sanctuary of the exotic white Bali Starling , an endemic iconic bird of the island of the gods Leucopsar rothschildi or "Jalak Bali" balinese bird habitat. Since 1966 it has been entered into the Red Data Book, the book includes species of flora and acre fauna endangered by IUCN ( International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources).West Bali National Park is truly a natural treasure of the fabled island of Bali.
 
 Most visitors to the park arrive along the north coast road from Lovina (about 90 minutes) or Pemuteran (about 15 minutes). Others come from the south via Gilimanuk harbor which is the main port that connects Java with Bali (about 15 minutes). From the capital city of Denpasar, the trip will take roughly about 4 to 5 hours along the main west road that connects Denpasar to Gilimanuk.
 
 All visitors should check in at one of the two park offices (PHPA) for information, and to obtain permits and arrange guides. The headquarters is at the village of Cekik just south of Gilimanuk in the west. The other is at Labuan Lalang on the north coast from where boats to Menjangan Island depart. The main ranger station is on the road between the two offices at Sumber Klampok.

Quite a mismanaged national park, Indonesian style. The road going into the national park is in very bad condition and not inviting to use your car to go deeper into the national park. So I parked at the front office and went in by foot. During my 5km walk in there were often local fishermen passing with loud motorcycle engines obviously not caring for any birds or wildlife. So clearly no birds or wildlife around that route! Also some cars passing with local people bringing offerings to the temples inside the national park. Overall disappointing experience. Both for management and wildlife sightings. There are much better areas around the national park where you don't have to pay (such high) entrance fees and much more wildlife/birds around there. A national park where birding is better outside than inside, can you imagine??
 Also, the entrance fee is 20 times more for foreigners (200 000) than for locals (10 000), even with the correct permit documents and already living a long time in Indonesia. IF the experience would be worth it I would not mind to pay 200k but it is NOT worth it. Better go birding just outside the national park boundary areas and have some great sightings there! Enjoy...

Dan di temukan juga Tirta Sudha mala' Alas angker di sebelah selatan Pure Tirta Empul. Visited the place and taking the easiest trail, Brumbun trail at the East side that face Menjangan Island. We can see deer, Bali starling and two types of primates. We took this Brumbun trail since we shall continue with snorkeling trip at Menjangan Island, thus taking the whole day trip by taking boat from Bangsal Harbour (30 minutes boat ride one way) and playing in the same vicinity. It was a sea bed that was propped up to become land above the sea. The ground is made from sharp coral, thus ensure you are wearing a good protected tracking boots. Do not wear sport shoes or sandals. You may need also walking stick since descending the coral hill may produce nasty cut if you fall down.
 
 The view from the hill top is nice, with wide view to West to Mt. Ijen at Java island and Menjangan Island at the East. However once I reached the top, I figure that most of the other trail will have the same experience. Thus this half day excursion should be enough to get the experience of the whole park, unless you are really keen into observing animals in the full day trail on the West side of the park.
